loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián  es  una persona  responsable  y  muy trabajadora  que   día   con día se  esfuerza por salir  adelante, el se preocupa  por acondicionar  su  vivienda  es  por  ello que se  acerco  con nosotros ya  que  requiere  realizar  mejoras en su  domicilio   en esta  ocasión necesita construir  la losa  de   concreto  de  uno de los cuartos  que  esta  realizando,  nos  comenta que   gracias  al  crédito  anterior  logro  avanzar  la  construcción pero no le  había  sido  posible  concluir  con esta  ya  que  no  cuenta  con el  capital  suficiente,  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la realización de su  proyecto  y  hacer  de su  sueño  una  realidad.
texts.en: Julián is a responsible, hardworking man who strives each day to get ahead. He wants to air condition his house. He came to us to make improvements to his home. Now he needs to build a concrete wall for one of the rooms under construction. He says that the previous loan helped him start the construction, but he was not able to finish it because he lacked sufficient capital. He is grateful for the help to complete this project and make his dream a reality.

loans.use: to build a concrete wall.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La joven Luz Marina de 26 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en su casa ubicada en San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras. Dedicándose al comercio de venta de abarrotaría en su pulpería en donde vende frescos, agua, detergentes, Lácteos, embutidos, jabón huevos y otros productos de consumo básico. Sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan para comprar sus productos.
Luz Marina solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como agua, frescos, lácteos, carnes, jabón y detergentes.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir creciendo.
Su sueño es que su pulpería sea la más grande de la zona, para fortalecer sus ingresos y ayudara a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents in their house in San Lorenzo, Valle in the south of Honduras.  She works selling groceries at her store including sodas, water, detergents, dairy products, canned goods, soap, eggs, and other basic products.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends who visit daily to purchase their products.  

Luz Marina is asking for this loan to purchase products such as water, sodas, dairy products, meat, soap, and detergents.  With the support of this loan, she will continue investing in her business and continue growing.  

Her dream is that her store is the largest one in the area, to strengthen her income, and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase water, soda, dairy products, meat, soap, and detergents for her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with three children. She is 47 years old and lives in San Juan, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Elena has been selling a variety of different vegetables to earn a living for the past two years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP from her business. 

Elena has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to procure more vegetables to sell. In 2011, she joined GDMPC. In the future, Elena wants to build a house and to help her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to procure more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. Prescilla has a food retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Prescilla has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Prescilla hopes to improve her business to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 52 years old and married with three children. For the past 10 years, she has run a retail business in the Philippines and she works hard to provide for her family.  Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 18 previous loans from NWTF. She also earns an income from growing rice and raising livestock.

Rebecca is requesting a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor  Mario tiene 50 años de edad,  vive en la localidad de Puerto Rico, el se dedica  a  la  compra y venta de papa en la localidad de el Torno compra por mayor de los  campesinos de la zona y también de la ciudad de Sucre y luego lo revende, el señor es separado de su esposa, tiene dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad pero viven  con el.   El destino del crédito es para la compra de  papa por mayor  ya que tiene bastante  pedido para entregar ya que  hay mucha demanda en estos días y quiere aprovechar eso ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y ahora necesita el dinero para ya que  realizara el viaje a Sucre de donde trae también una buena cantidad de papa,  El se encuentra en su  decima secta secuencia, siempre a cancelado puntual,  por tal motivo se siente feliz y  muy  agradecido por el apoyo económico brindado por la institución.
texts.en: Mario, 50, lives in Puerto Rico and sells potatoes in Torno. He buys potatoes wholesale from farmers in the area and in the city of Sucre and later  resells them. He is separated from his wife. He has two adult children who live with him. He will use the loan to buy potatoes at wholesale as he already has orders to deliver because the demand is high these days, and he wants to take advantage of it. The previous loan cycle went well, and now he needs money to go to Sucre, where he buys a lot of potatoes. He is in his tenth loan cycle and has always been punctual with payments. He feels happy and very grateful for the financial help provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy potatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Greysi

texts.es:
La joven Greysi de 25 años de edad, es madre de un hijo su pareja tuvo que irse para los Estados Unidos en busca del sueño americano, ella vive con su suegra en su casa de habitación ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, Honduras, Greysi se dedica desde hace 6 años al negocio de pulpería donde ella atiende aun buen numero de clientes de su comunidad en su pulpería ella vende frescos, granos básicos, detergentes, churros, agua, y carnes.
Greysi solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como pollo, embutidos, lácteos, granos básicos, y refrescos.
Greysi esta muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA por el apoyo que se le ha dado a su negocio y por ende su condición de vida esta mejorando.
El sueño de Greysi es que su esposo regrese bien de los estados unidos y pueda tener a su familia completa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Greysi is 25 years old and the mother of a son.  Her partner had to go to the United States in search of the American dream.  She lives with her mother-in-law in her home located in the community of San Lorenzo, Honduras.  

Greysi has worked for six years tending her store where she attends to a number of customers in her community.  Her store sells sodas, basic grains, detergents, churros, water, and meats.  

Greysi is asking for this loan to purchase products such as chicken, sausages, dairy products, basic grains, and sodas.  She is very happy to continue working with PRISMA because of the help they have given her business and because her living conditions are improving.

Greysi's dream is that her husband returns safely from the United States so they can be a family together.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, sausages, dairy products, basic grains, and sodas for her store.

loans.name: Edraline

texts.en:
Edraline is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Edraline has a food retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

Edraline has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Edraline hopes to improve her business to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling frozen food products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. Lucille earns additional income from fattening pigs and making hollow blocks (concrete blocks).

Lucille has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more frozen food products to sell in her business.

Lucille dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food products to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old and married with two children. For the past 18 years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from raising pigs. Susan works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 21 previous loans through NWTF. 

Susan is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan for her sari-sari (variety) business. This will be her third loan cycle. She has previously funded her ready-to-wear clothing business with loans through NWTF. Her business continues to provide Elvie and her family with an income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products to sell

loans.name: Dimar

texts.es: El Sr. Dimar, nacido en Chuquisaca vive con su pareja la Sra. María, tienen dos hijos. Ella es ama de casa, y él se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, hace más de 11 años, ellos viven en el Porvenir  en la provincia cordillera. Distante a 40 km. De Limoncito Torno,  donde tienen su parcela donde siembran sandia, maíz, cítricos y yuca, el crédito que han solicitado es para la siembra de sandia y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra y también siembran maíz, sorgo, y poroto, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien  tubo buenos ingresos, Todo lo que ellos siembran lo venden directo del productor al consumidor en el mercado de la zona, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dimar, born in Chuquisaca, lives with his wife María, and has two children. She is a homemaker, and he has been farming and raising livestock for over 11 years. They live in Porvenir, located in a mountainous province about 40 km from Limoncito Torno, where they have a smallholding on which they grow watermelon, corn, citrus fruits, and yucca.
 
They are asking for a loan to plant watermelon and pay the costs of preparing the land. They will also plant corn, sorghum, and beans, since the previous loan investment was successful. Everything they plant is sold directly to local consumers. They are happy and grateful for the institution's help.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing watermelon.

loans.name: Esther Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Esther a tiene 30 años, tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad,    ella se dedica a la venta de comida,  ella vive en la zona San Jorge y en la misma zona vende comida,  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Esther va  a utilizar este préstamo para capital de inversión para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra  de mesas y sillas para su segunda actividad que es la venta de comida, Esther enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el reto que enfrenta es la falta de mesas y sillas ya que esto no le permite brindar comodidad a su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando sus actividades, su deseo es tener una pensión, la Sra. Esther tiene ganas de superación de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Esther is 30 years old. She has a 7 year old son. She sells food and lives in the area of San Jorge. This loan is her fourth cycle with the institution. Esther is going to use this loan for investment capital for her business. The reason she asked for this loan is to buy tables and chairs for her second activity, which is selling food. Esther faces challenges in her business such as the lack of tables and chairs. This doesn't allow her to offer her customers comfort. She will use the earnings to keep improving her activities. Her goal is to have a boarding house. Esther wants to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of ukay-ukay (used) clothes to resell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, aged 48, is from Poblacion, Pana-on. She is a widow and has three children. To make a living, Josephine manages a fish pond where she raises fish, crabs and shrimp for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Josephine joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand her business.

loans.name: Sedrita

texts.en:
Sedrita is 59 years old and married with three children. For the past 29 years, she has run a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Sedrita is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Sedrita is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lodrina

texts.en:
Lodrina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past three years and also earns additional income from a general store. Lodrina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans through NWTF.

Lodrina is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried fish for her business. In the future, she dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothes, or ukay-ukay, to resell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is married and has one child. She is 35 years old and resides in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Philippines. 

Teofila plants, harvests and sells root crops and bananas to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 4,000. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2011, Teofila joined GDMPC. In the future, Teofila wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, from the village of Cabisera 17-21, is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. 

For more than eight years Gloria has been raising pigs for fattening and sale, and is now requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP that will be used to purchase feed and vitamins as she raises her young pig for future sale. 

Gloria hopes eventually to expand her business to better support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Berenice

texts.es: La señora  Berenice es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su hogar y a su trabajo, ella quiere su crédito para arreglar su vivienda, nos comenta que en este momento desea  enyesar y pintar  las paredes  exteriores de  su vivienda para que  esta tenga  una  mejor imagen  ya que es el patrimonio de su  familia, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Berenice is a responsible person, dedicated to her home and work. She wishes a loan to remodel her house. She tells us that she wants to plaster and paint the exterior walls of the house so that it looks better, since it is her family's property. She appreciates the help offered to complete her project.

loans.use: to paint and plaster the exterior walls of her house.

loans.name: Gs El Cedrito I Group

texts.es:
El Señor Víctor es una persona muy emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. En Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 5 años de tener este tipo de negocio.
Don Víctor el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, cal, refrescos, azúcar, café, pan, dulces, confites y Otros Productos de Consumo. De esta manera incrementara más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera mejorar sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes. Con estos fondos espera que su negocio sea más sólido y rentable.
Don Víctor sueña con darles a sus hijos y a su madre lo mejor.
Marelene se dedica a su negocio propio pulpería desde hace más de 3 años.
Sayda se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas y fabricación de piñatas.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Víctor is a very enterprising person who is dedicated to his business. He lives with his wife and children in Choluteca in southern Honduras. He has more than 5 years experience in this type business.

Víctor will invest the loan in buying corn, firewood, lime, bevergaes, sugar, coffee, bread, candies, pastries and more products. In this way he will increase his sales. With the loan he hopes to improve his sales and serve his customers better. With these funds he hopes for his business to be more solid and profitable. 

Víctor dreams of giving his children and their mother the best. 
Marelene has had her own small grocery store for more than 3 years.
Sayda buys and sells chickens and makes piñatas.
Choluteca, Honduras - June, 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, beverages, sugar, coffee, bread, candies, pastries and other products for his business.

loans.name: Oyunsuren

texts.en:
Oyunsuren, aged 51, lives in her own small house in Bulgan province, Mongolia. Her husband passed away a year ago. Her children live separately. Oyunsuren started her business making pizzas in 2011. There are no competitors for her business in the local area. Usually, she makes vegetable pizzas. She is well known by the local residents and they always appreciate her pizzas as they are delicious and healthy.  Thus, her business has become sustainable and has many regular customers.  

In the future, Oyunsuren wants to expand her business by increasing the number of product items and by building her own workplace. She is a diligent and hard-working woman. She said, " I need to purchase an oven in order to increase my business income as well as my profit."  She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase an oven and organic vegetables to increase the range of her products.

loans.use: To purchase an oven and organic vegetables

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap, age 40, is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Chenla, age 37, is a garment worker. They have been married since 1993 and have one daughter, who is a garment worker. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Leap is applying for his first loan in the amount of $1,500 to repair the roof and walls of his house and to level up his house foundation.

loans.use: To repair the roof and walls of his house and level up his house foundation.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a widow with six children. She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Felisa is a farmer, and she manages a garden business for a living. She has been doing this for five years, and every month she earns 3,500. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase fertilizer.

Felisa has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Felisa hopes her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Adhemar

texts.es: El Sr. Adhemar tiene 26 años, tiene un hijo de un años de edad su actividad es la venta de vidrios en su vidriería que se encuentran en la zona  Guapuru,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Adhemar utilizara el crédito para la compra de variedad de vidrios para surtir su mercadería y también la compra de maquinas para la vidriería, Adhemar enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la falta de materiales y maquinas y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando herramientas y materiales para su vidriería ya que poco a poco va creciendo, esta es su única actividad con la que me mantiene a su hijito, su deseo es tener un negocio grande y rentable que le permita generar más ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adhemar, 26, has a young son. He sells glass in his glass shop located in Guapuru. This is his first loan cycle with the institution, and Adhemar will use the loan to buy a variety of glass for stock and also buy machinery for the glass shop. The challenge Adhemar faces in his business is lack of materials and machinery. 

He is going to use the profits to invest in tools and materials for his glass works, which is slowly expanding. This is his sole means of support for his young son. He hopes to have a large, profitable business that will generate more income and provide a better life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of glass and machinery for his glass shop.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: La señora Maricela es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora la cual tiene cuatro años con su negocio de venta  de  comida  rápida como  burritos  y  hamburguesas , este le  a  permitido  sacar  a su  familia adelante, ella   nos  comenta  que  su   numero de clientes  a  aumentado y  en este  momento   requiere  realizar  la compra  de  materia  prima  para  continuar trabajando , ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio  y de   brindar a  sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio que  la a  caracterizado por  lo  que  se  encuentra  muy  contenta,  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para  realizar  su  proyecto  además de la facilidad  para  realizar   sus  pagos.
texts.en: Maricela is a hardworking and enterprising person who has been selling fast food, such as burritos and hamburgers, for four years. This allows her to get her family ahead. She tells us that the number of customers she has had increased and right now she needs to buy ingredients to be able to keep working. She sees in the loan the possibility of making her business grow and offering her customers the excellent she is known for. She is very happy with the loan and grateful for the support offered to undertake this project as well as for the ease of making the payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her fast food.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Maximina works hard to support her family. She has a business in the Philippines in which she is an ambulant vendor of fermented shrimps and fish and she earns additional income from selling fruit. 

Maximina is borrowing PHP 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase containers of fermented products to sell in her business.

Maximina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase containers of fermented products to sell

loans.name: Naome

texts.en:
Naome, aged 31, is married and has two children who are both in school. She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Naome has been raising livestock for five years now.

She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Naome has now requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Helcunida

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Helcunida works hard to support her family. She runs a shell craft business in the Philippines. Helcunida has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Helcunida is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her craft business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase material for her shell craft business

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun is a widow with one son and two daughters. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Savoeun is a silk weaver and she also buys rice to sell. 

Savoeun is requesting an 800 USD loan to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business. She will also use a part of her loan to buy more rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase silk for her weaving business and to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Marina Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Marina Natividad, es casada, tiene 33 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la confección de tejidos, especificamente a la confeccion de delantales típicos, lleva 11 años de experiencia en este trabajo, inició siendo operaria y ahora hace sus propios trabajos en la casa, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para comprar de telas tipicas y adornos, para que esta forma pueda seguir con el trabajo que realiza actualmente. Espera ver su negocio superado y con mejores ganancias, y mas capital.
texts.en:
Marina Natividad is married, 33,  finished 6 years of primary education, and has 3 children attending school. She weaves cloth, specifically for traditional aprons. She has 11 years of experience in this profession, where she started as an operator and now has her own business at home. Her husband, who is a bricklayer, also helps the household financially.

She requests a loan to buy traditional cloths and trimmings to continue the work she currently does. She hopes to see her business succeed with more profits and capital.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and trimmings.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Delma  has a food retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

Delma has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. Delma has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is a housewife and a small entreprenuer who lives in Cataggaman with her spouse and children. She has three adult children who have their own employment now but still live with her and her husband. Instead of lazing at home, Genie has opened a specialized store selling books, magazines and other reading materials. Her hobby is to read books and she is very happy to have this type of business. 

Genie usually earns about PHP 15,000 each month and uses this for daily meals and monthly electricity bills. Other parts of her income are also used to reinvest in the business. Genie would like to buy more books, magazines and encyclopedias to re-sell for profit and is therefore asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. This will help to increase her sales and earn additional revenue. Someday, Genie hopes to establish a larger store with convenient shelves to display her books.

loans.use: to buy books, magazines and encyclopedias to re-sell for profit

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 34 years old and married with four children. For the past nine years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from a motorcycle transport business and an electronics business. Elvie works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 10 previous loans from NWTF.

Elvie is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She aspires to save enough to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Saroem, age 28, (pictured above) works for a dog-food factory. Her husband, Sovannara, age 24, is a garment worker. They have been married since 2010 and just have one young son. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Saroem is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,300 to buy a motorbike to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Wualter Alexis

texts.es: Wualter tiene 26 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de 2 añitos, su esposa es ama de casa, es una familia muy unida, responsable, respetuosa, y honrada, ellos residen en la comunidad de La Esperanza, Trojes, El Paraíso. Desde hace 6 años Wualter se dedica al cultivo de café, comenzó trabajando con su padre que le enseño desde muy pequeño a sembrar, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm. Las ventajas es que el negocio es seguro y la desventaja es que la cosecha es una vez al año. El préstamo que solicita Wualter lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de abono, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá mejorar su finca y así tener una mejor cosecha. Los desafíos que enfrenta como productor es la baja de los precios y que tiene que lidiar con los intermediarios ya que quieren comprar el producto a un precio muy bajo. Uno de sus sueños es mejorar la finca para tener una mejor producción de café. Este es el segundo financiamiento que obtiene Wualter en FAMA y hasta el momento ha  cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Wualter is 26 years old, married, and has a 2 year old son.  His wife is a housewife and they have a very united, responsible, respectful, and honest family.  They live in the community of La Esperanza, Trojes, El Paraíso. 

For six years, Wualter has worked cultivating coffee.  He started working with his father who taught him since he was very young to plant.  His work schedule is 6:00am until 2:00pm.  The advantage is that his business is secure, and the disadvantage is that the harvest is one time a year.  

Wualter is asking for this loan to purchase manure, fertilizer, and pay laborers.  This loan will help improve his farm so that he can have a better harvest.  The challenges he faces as a producer are the lowering of prices and that he has to deal with middlemen who want to purchase his product at a very low price.  

One of his dreams is to improve his farm to have better coffee production.  This is his second loan with FAMA and he has always made his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer for his coffee crop and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To furnish and repair his workplace

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 38 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Nilda has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 11 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Nilda has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Nilda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family's future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Jadambaa

texts.en:
Jadambaa, 38,  lives with his wife and his parents in a small house his parents own in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He used to live in Zamiin-Uud, Mongolia, but a few years ago he moved in Ulaanbaatar to look after his parents.  Jadambaa's wife runs a taxi service and he works at a pharmacy delivering medicine to customers.  A hybrid car is important to Jadambaa's job delivering medicine but he does not have enough money saved to purchase a hybrid.

Jadambaa is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a hybrid vehicle. He is a hardworking and honorable guy who says, "a few years ago, when  my son passed away, my life stopped and I became to live without hope. But now I am trying to start a new life again."

loans.use: to buy a hybrid car to deliver medicine

loans.name: Bencrazbee

texts.en:
Bencrazbee lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. He has made a living for the past 14 years by transporting passengers on his motorbike in order to support the needs of his 10 children. He earns an income of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

For a 48-year-old father, there’s nothing that could make him happier than seeing his children succeed in their studies. Without hesitation, Bencrazbee is borrowing 9,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair his vehicle and hence provide his children with a better education. He joined GDMPC in 2011 and his plan for the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle he uses for his taxi business

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shells-crafts business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business for her shells crafts business.

NWTF is relisting Luna 's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like nylon for her shells crafting business

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh, age 36, is from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house in an outer ger district lacks basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar. His son is 2 years old and daughter is new born only two months. Batmunkh started his auto repair business in 2000 at own small yard which closest to his home. First few years he made only wheel repair and after few years he started to sell wheels which imports from Japan. 

Nowadays mostly of drivers like complex service, they want to visit the repair service who serves a many kind services and etc. so Batmunkh is requesting a 3.000.000  MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more wheels and other necessary implements in order to attracts more customers and increase his income. As his daughter  is new born, he need more money.

loans.use: to purchase more wheels in order to attract more customer drivers.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita, married who has 3 children. Esterlita is 50 years old, and resides at Dinas, Sinacaban, Philippines. Esterlita manages a gardening business to earn a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2004, Esterlita joined GDMPC. In the future, Esterlita wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Grace has a mini store that sells spices and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of spices and snacks to re-sell.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy spices and snacks to re-sell.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los Angeles, es una mujer que vive en la provincia de Puntarenas, en el cantón de Coto Brus, en el distrito de Agua Buena, esta es una región ubicada en la Zona Sur de Costa Rica, es un area montañosa, donde los primeros colonizadores familaias Italianas, a quienes el gobierno les dio tierras, comenzarón con el cultivo de café, y despues se ha ido diversificando la producción a granos basicos, asi como a la ganaderia por la topografia del terreno.
En el caso de María, ella ademas de tener sembrado platano, café, tambien ha comenzado desde el año anterior el cultivo de papa, para este último cultivo es que requiere financiamiento, para la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas, para asegurarse una buena cosecha, la misma se comercializa por medio de compradores de papa que se desplazan hasta la zona y la llevan a otros lugares para venderla.
Esta es una actividad familiar donde participa tambien su esposo, Miguel Angel, esta es una familia que vive de la explotación de la finca, como unica fuente de ingreso, por esta razón cuando se da la cosecha de café y la de la papa, deben guardar dinero para poder hacerle frente a los gastos de todo el año, lo que complementan con la venta de platanos, cultivo que tiene un ciclo de producción mas corto.
Como un plan a futuro desean poder seguir ayudando a su hija a continuar sus estudios asi como ir ampliando la zona de cultivo de papa, ya que han visto que es un producto que se da muy bien en la zona.
texts.en:
María de los Angeles lives in Puntarenas province located in the Agua Buena district of Coto Brus canton in southern Costa Rica, where the first Italian immigrant families who received land from the government began planting coffee. Later, they diversified by producing basic grains and raising livestock suited to the area's topography.

Last year, in addition to planting bananas and coffee, María also began planting potatoes, which requires funding to buy fertilizers and pesticides to ensure a good harvest. This harvest is purchased by potato buyers who sell in the area and other locations. Hers is a family activity in which her husband Miguel Angel also works. The farm is the family's sole source of income. This means that money from the coffee and potato harvests, plus that garnered from banana sales from a much shorter growing period, must suffice to pay expenses for the entire year.

Their plan is to continue paying for their daughter's education and expanding their potato plantings, which do very well in this area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Altan-Ochir

texts.en: Altan-Ochir, 26, lives with his wife and his two sons in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Tosontsengel, Mongolia. His two sons stay at home. His wife looks after them and helps with his business. He started his auto and wheel repair business in 2009 on rental workplace. He bought the land and built a workplace to expand his business in 2011. Currently, His business is sustainable and has many regular customers. He is well known by the local residents and they always appreciate his service quality. Also, he operates trash delivery business. The trash is the biggest environmental problem in Mongolia. Therefore, he has decided to buy a truck to take households waste to the dump.  He is a hardworking and humble man. He is planning to build a house by increasing his business income. He is requesting 5,000,000 MNT to buy a truck.

loans.use: To buy a truck to take households waste to the dump

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cellphone load from GLOBE and SMART to re sell

loans.name: Sreytin

texts.en:
Sreytin (in the photo), age 24, is a garment worker. She has just been married for two months and has no children. Her husband, Sophenet, age 26, works for water utility authority. Sreytin lives with her parents a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Sreytin is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike to get to work. She will also use a part of money from the loan to help capital her mother to buy additional grocery items for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work and help her mother to buy additional grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 47 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. Tessie runs a retail store at home selling assorted items like coffee, milk, soft drinks, and other basic necessities needed by everyone. She's in business for 11 years and earns 4,000 a month from store operations. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase new items to expand product offering. Tessie joined the GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Tessie hopes to obtain good return from this investment and acquire enough revolving funds for the business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny (in the photo), age 30, is a garment worker. Her husband, Vith, age 31, his business is in purchasing, raising, and selling cow and ox. To earn additional income, he also does construction works. He hopes to expand his business by purchasing more cows and oxen for resale. Hence, Vanny is asking for a loan of $1,000 to provide her husband’s capital.

Vanny and her husband have live in a village, about forty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1999 and have three children-one son and two daughters. All of their children are in school.

loans.use: To help her husband to purchase more cows and oxen for resale.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen (in the photo) is 33 years old and his wife, Sophea is 30 years old, live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and just have one young daughter.  

Khen is a rice farmer and does construction work when he is not at farm. His wife is a garment worker. He is applying for a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorized hand tiller to assist in his rice farming.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller to assist in his rice farming.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 46 years old,married and lives in the Philippines. 
Leonardo is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 8 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Leonardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future,Leonardo hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Jesebel

texts.en:
Jesebel has a food vending business to earn a living. Her main source of income comes from selling barbecued food in her community. She has been in this type of business for six years. She earns 5,000 PHP each month from these activities. Jesebel is 46 years old and lives in Mialen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of eight children. 

Jesebel has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients to banana barbecue and to purchase kitchen utensils for food preparation. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Jesebel hopes to expand her vending and have a stall in the city.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to banana barbecue and purchase kitchen utensils for food preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more textiles for making gowns and ready-to-wear clothes

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin of Sinara Bajo, Jimenez help her family through providing construction supplies business. He is 52 years old, married, who tries his best to earn. For 4 years, he manage this business and earns about 7,500 per month. For the time being, he needs to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. He joined last 2011 and thanks to GDMPC micro finance for the loan of 9,000 they provide to him. Benjamin desires to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe, married who has 5 children. Maria Fe is 42 years old, and resides at Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Maria Fe cultivates flowers for a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,500 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to buy pesticides. In 2006, Maria Fe joined GDMPC. In the future, Maria Fe wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides.

loans.name: Camra

texts.en:
Camra is 47 years old and has 6 children. Camra is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Camra is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Camra requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Camra has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Camra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en: Meraluna  is  40  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Meraluna  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 7  years. She requested a loan for  5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Meraluna  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future,Meraluna hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ma. Josie

texts.en:
43-year-old Ma. Josie is a married woman with 5 children who are aged between 2 and 14 years. Her husband is a fisherman.

Josie supports her family through seaweed farming. She has been in this kind of business for 10 years now. Josie works hard to help provide for their household needs and to send their children to school. She has requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, ropes and other materials. Josie hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, ropes and other materials

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is from Mohon, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Charlita is married and has 5 children.

To make a living, Charlita owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. Charlita sell it by door to door basis to her "suki" buyer. Charlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Charlita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials in making "puto". Puto is the classic steamed Filipino rice cake shaped like an American muffin. Its texture is spongy and slightly fluffy. Puto is traditionally white, but can be colored pink, yellow, purple, even green. There are many regional variations of puto.
In 2010, Charlita joined GDMPC. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and portion of it will be save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in making "puto".

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. Alfredo  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. He had this business for 10  years. He requested a loan for  5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Alfredo  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Alfredo hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en: Simplicia is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, province of Isabela. She is 60 years old. Simplicia is married and has three adult children. Simplicia makes general household furniture and sells it to local businesses and community members. Simplicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. The purpose of the loan is to purchase raw materials like nail, varnish, wood and wood glue for her furniture to make additional income. Simplicia is requesting 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy nails, varnish, wood and wood glue for her furniture business.

loans.name: Chorm Neary Rothtanak

texts.en:
Chorm Neary Rothtanak (in the photo) is 29 years old and her husband, Sopheap, is 26 years old. The couple has been married since 2006, and they just have one young son. They live a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Chorm Neary Rothtanak and her husband are garment workers.  She hopes to expand her property, which is why she is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,300 to buy the neighboring land.

loans.use: to expand her land property by buying the neighboring land.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en: From the village of Cabisera 17-21, hardworking and diligent Rubelyn is married and manages her own store, selling a variety of products in the community. Rubelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, milk, shampoo, and soap for her store to earn additional income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, milk, shampoo, and soap for her store.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Leonides is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 4,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Leonides has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future,Leonides hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Erlin

texts.en: Erlin is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.Erlin  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for  5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Erlin  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Erlin hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is 50 years old (in the photo) and her husband, Phyrum is 33 years old, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1998 and have not children yet. 

Neang sells grocery at home. She buys grocery items from market, approximately 6 Km from her house. Her husband is assisting his wife in the business. She wants to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items. Neang will better respond her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items.

loans.name: Davaatseren

texts.en:
Davaatseren is 35 years old married guy and lives with his wife, two sons and one daughter in outer district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  His elder two children attend secondary school, but now their summer vacation time so they baby sit their younger brother who is 4. 

Davaatseren owns a small yards, and on this yard he grasses a field. Mongolian summer time is very sunny and very comfortable for grassing field and also he is experienced for it about few years. When he picked vegetables he sells it during the winter season, it’s the very beneficial.  But the very big problem this kind of business is keeping condition. 

I mentioned that summer in Mongolia is very sunny and also plus very sultriness hot weather. Thus vegetables may soon-rotting, so Davaatseren needs vegetable storage pit on his yard.  With helping this loan he will purchase necessary building materials to build vegetable storage pit.

loans.use: to build vegetable storage pit on his small yard

loans.name: Jena

texts.en: Jena is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.Jena  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for  5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Jena has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jena hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Banco Mujer Promujer Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo de mujeres que viven en la provincia de Puntarenas, en el cantón de Corredores, en el distrito Darizara, en la zona Sur de Costa Rica, caracterizada por la poca oferta de empleos remunerados para personas que superan los cuarenta años como es el caso de la mayoría de las integrantes del grupo, de allí que a estas mujeres tengan que generar una fuente de autoempleo, lo cual logran con la venta de productos de catálogo, donde se ofrece una gran variedad de articulos tanto para el cuido personal, ropa, articulos para el hogar, bisuteria ete, y es en lo que invertiran este préstamo cinco compañeras, hay dos que se dedican a la confección de ropa interior las que comercializan sus productos por medio de sus compañeras, con lo que se logra una mayor solidaridad entre ellas.
Aún cuando estas mujeres viven muy cerca de la frontera con Panama, donde existe una zona comercial muy fuerte, tienen la posibilidad de comercializar sus productos, primero por ofrecerlos mediante el sistema de pagos, asi como por la calidad de los productos que ofrecen.
Dentro de los planes a futuro de estas señoras esta el poder seguir haciendo un aporte a la economia domestica, logrando con ello mejorar la calidad de vida, ya que en la mayoria de los casos, son mujeres solas y las que tienen compañeros devengan salarios bajos o estan subempleados; de alli que la actividad de estas mujeres sea importante en la generación de ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
This is a group of women who live in the Puntarenas province, Corredores canton, Darizara district, in the southern zone of Costa Rica.  It is known for low availability of employment for people over 40, which is the case with the majority of the members of this group.  Therefore, these women need to generate a source of self-employment.  They manage to do this by selling products by catalog.  They sell a great variety of goods like personal care items, clothes, household goods, and jewelry, etc.  Five of the members will use the loan to invest in this.  Two of the members make underwear.  They sell their products through their colleagues, which creates greater solidarity between them.

Even though these women live close to the Panamanian border, where there is a very strong commercial zone, they have the opportunity to sell their products.  They sell through a payments system, and their products sell because of their quality.

Among the future plans for these women is to be able to keep being a financial support to the household.  This way they achieve a greater quality of life.  The majority of them are women alone, and those that have life partners are paid low salaries or are underemployed.

That is why the business activities of these women are so important to generate income for their families.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like underwear, perfume, and cosmetics by catalog.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 27 years old and is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She does not have children yet and hopes and prays to have one soon.

Maribel has been involved in seaweed farming for 2 years. Her husband is a fisherman and they both work hard to support themselves and save for the future. Aside from seaweed farming, Maribel also owns a videoke machine that she rents to people in her community. She also sells snack foods to her customers.

Maribel is requesting a loan to purchase snack foods to sell and seaweed seedlings. Maribel hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods to sell and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Map

texts.en:
Map (in the photo) and his wife, Sophan, have been married since 1979 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home, two are security guards, one is a construction worker and another one attends school. The family lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Map is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a new motorized hand tiller because his old one breaks and does not work well.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Bayque

texts.en:
Bayque is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Bayque is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Bayque has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her services for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin (in the photo), age 26, is a garment worker. Her husband, Deth, age 27, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2010 and just have one young daughter. The family lives in a village about forty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chin is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work. Because Chin’s husband works quite far from the home, he needs to stay at his work place after work. With a motorbike, which he will buy with money from the loan, he will be able to come back home every evening to help support his wife at home.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 32 years old and has three children. He does tailoring to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has two employees. Besides that, he sells tea leaves to generate extra income. Previously, he used to sell used clothes. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him grow his business. He has also become more business-oriented because he has been trained in business management. He dreams of opening an industry and employing people. He needs a loan of 25,000 KES to buy fabrics and a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and a sewing machine

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Leonora has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 53 years old, married to a farmer and they have three children. Her youngest still attends school, while the rest have their employment already. The family owns a hectare rice field on which they cultivate, plant and harvest rice. Rice farming is the family's primary source of income. 

Fe would like to ensure a more productive harvest, so she is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to invest in buying fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides necessary in farming. She promises to pay back her loan in full and she hopes to keep growing as a successful farmer someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang (in the photo) is 41 years old and sells sandwiches on baguettes in her village. Her husband, Phanak is 42 years old, assists his wife in the business.  

Additionally, Samnang rents out a space in her house. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair her house and build one more room to rent.

loans.use: to repair her house and build one more room to rent.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is both a motor taxi driver and rice farmer and his wife, Nguong Eng (pictured together), is a weaver. Ly is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase two cows to raise. He will get extra income from selling the cows for beef or selling a calf when the cow has a baby. 

Ly and is wife live in a village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have two children who attend school.

loans.use: to purchase two cows to raise.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La socia Maria vive en la hermosa provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de socia Maria es la agricultura pues se dedica a venta de maíz por mayor. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. María también se dedica a la venta de maíz y tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergente y otras cosas más.  En esta oportunidad Maria requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. 

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes” en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; Agricultura y ganadería.   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the beautiful province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. Maria's main economic activity is agriculture; she works selling corn on a wholesale basis. She has dedicated herself to this business for several years, and it is going very well for her. Maria also works selling corn, and she has a small grocery store where she sells basic staple products such as rice, sugar, noodles, detergent and other items. At this time, Maria needs the loan to buy sacks of rice and sacks of sugar. 

This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the communal bank "Virgen de las Mercedes” in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. This communal bank is composed of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead, and with their daily efforts to provide a better future for their children. The members' economic activities include, for example, agriculture and livestock raising. 

All of the members are grateful for the opportunity provided, and they are committed to making their various payments on schedule. 

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, at the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas. It is known as a touristic area, thanks to his archaeological sites, its historic city center, its landscapes, its history, and its character as an enchanting city of the country's southern region. Cusco is also known for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi, and because one of the seven wonders of the world is located there: Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Cada día desde muy temprano Marcelo se levanta a trabajar en la finca de café que le heredó su padre cuando se casó con Irene. Al principio era un terreno pequeño pero con el paso del tiempo ha podido ir incrementando la extensión de este gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Su esposa y sus 3 hijos también le ayudan en esta labor ya que es un negocio familiar y cuando es época de cosecha él contrata gente pues la carga de trabajo es demasiada. El café que producen es en parte convencional y en parte orgánico y quiere hacer la conversión para que la producción sea en su totalidad orgánica, ya que tiene un mejor precio en el mercado y además contribuye a una mejor conservación del medio ambiente. Para hacer este cambio es necesario sembrar nueva planta y para esto él necesita de un crédito. También está interesado en recibir capacitación por parte de la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para aprovechar mejor los recursos que tiene y mejorar la calidad de su café. A Marcelo y a su esposa lo que más les preocupa es poder darle a sus 3 hijos una buena educación y quieren mandarlos a estudiar una carrera universitaria en el futuro.
texts.en:
Marcelo gets up very early each day to work on the coffee farm that he inherited from his father when he married Irene.  At first, it was a small parcel of land, but over time he has been able to extend it, thanks to his efforts and dedication.  His wife and their 3 children also help him with this work, because it is a family business.  When it is harvest season, he hires people because the job is too much for them to do on their own.  

The coffee that he produces is partly grown with traditional methods, and partly organic.  He wants to convert all of his crops into organic, because he can get a better price for them in the market and at the same time contribute to conserving the environment.  To make this change he must put in new coffee plants, and this is why he needs a loan.  He is also interested in receiving training from the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” organization so that he can take better advantage of the resources that he has and improve his quality of life.  For Marcelo and his wife, their main concern is providing their 3 children with a good education.  They want to send them to study for a university degree in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants to renew his farm

loans.name: Ulziijargal

texts.en:
Ulziijargal is a 45-year-old married man who lives with his son and wife in a ger, Mongolian felt tent, in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife works at a local kindergarten while their son attends secondary school. 

Ulziijargal is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to build a fence around his small yard because his family lives in a ger, and without a fence a ger is very unsafe. His goal in the future is when he finishes fencing work, he wishes to have a small grocery.

loans.use: to build a fence around his living area.

loans.name: Asymas

texts.en:
Asymas (in the photo) sells fish that her husband catches in local market. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and three daughters; four are in school and other two are still too young. 

Asymas wants to build a concreted brick room under her wooden house; it would be good for her to keep things safe from the elements. This is why she applied for a loan of $600.

loans.use: to build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Khol

texts.en:
Khol, age 41, is married to So his business partner. They live in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. This couple has given birth to five children - two married children and three single children. 

To provide daily sustenance for the family, Khol is in the business of making and trading Khmer natural medicines around the province. Most of his children help him in the business when they are free from their studies. The Khmer natural medicines are made of many kinds of tree roots and do not cause bad effects on people’s health. Cambodian people believe that some kinds of illness can’t be treated by modern medicines. From this type of business Khol can generate income around USD 8.00 per day which he uses to satisfy his living needs.

Due to the lack of vehicle Khol has encountered difficulties in transporting his medicines to the marketplaces. In connection to this matter, he would like to take out a loan in the amount of KHR 3,000,000 to purchase a motorcycle for the support of his business. Also, it’ll be used for household purposes. Khol hopes to receive this loan to better his living situation. He has been an honest client of HKL. With the previous four loans, Khol said that they really helped his family make good progress.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the support of his business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a resident of Cabisera 17-21 province of Isabela. She is 40 years old and married to Reynaldo, a farmer. They have two children, Erwin and Reymar.

Evangeline is engaged in a sari-sari store business (a community-based store). She sells different commodities that are needed in every household and she also sells vegetables that she displays in front of her store. With her need for business capital, she decided to request a loan of PHP 50,000. She plans to purchase more groceries for her store. She dreams that someday her two children will finish their studies and have a good future. She always keeps in mind these words, “If others can, why can’t I?”, as her motivation to work hard for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like canned goods, spices, drinks and vegetables.

loans.name: Borith

texts.en:
Borith (pictured here), age 30, is a garment worker, and her husband, Sam Ol, age 33, is an electrician. They have been married since 2000, and they just have one young son. The family lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Borith is in the process of building a concrete brick room under her wooden house and asks for a loan of $1,500 to finish it.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua con su negocio de venta y elaboracion de artesania como chompas,chalinas,guantes entre otros,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria repartiendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de lana de alpaca.
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the communal bank "Inti Quilla."  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

She is continuing with her business making and selling hand-make items such as sweaters, scarves, gloves and other items.  She sells from place to place, delivering her merchandise to the customers who request it the most.  She has had this business for a good amount of time, and it is going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day.   This is the way that she provides for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy alpaca wool.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen (in the photo) and his wife, Ry are farmers. They live in a suburb about 15 kilometers from Phnom Pen. They grow different kinds of vegetables and sell to a middleman who comes to buy at their home. 

Yen is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for commuting, because his old one breaks and uses more gasoline.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario y su esposo Baldomero se dedican a producir café desde hace más de 10 años. Junto con sus 5 hijos trabajan en sus fincas haciendo labores de limpieza, preparación de las tierras así como siembra y cosecha. Además Rosario también se encarga de las labores del hogar y su esposo por temporadas trabaja con otras personas para tener un ingreso extra para la familia. El café que ellos producen es convencional y quieren hacer el cambio a café orgánico pues es mejor pagado en el mercado y no daña el medio ambiente, ya que no utiliza fertilizantes con productos químicos. Para llevar a cabo esta tarea es necesario que siembren planta nueva y tomen un curso para aprovechar los recursos al máximo. Es por esto que necesitan de un crédito. Saben que si llevan a cabo esto tendrán mejores ingresos con los cuales podrán mandar a sus hijos a estudiar, ya que en la comunidad en donde viven no hay muchas opciones en cuanto a educación se refiere.
texts.en: Rosario and her husband, Baldomero, have been farming coffee for more than 10 years.  Together with their 5 children they work on their farms, clearing and preparing the land so that they can plant and later harvest.  Rosario is also in charge of the household chores, and her husband takes on seasonal work with other people so that they can have extra income for the family.  They produce conventional coffee, and they want to change to organic coffee. With organic coffee they can get a better price, and it doesn't damage the environment because it avoids the use of fertilizers and other chemical products.  To do this, it will be necessary for them to put in new plants and take a class so that they can take maximum advantage of their resources.  This is the reason that they are requesting a loan.  They know that if they carry out this plan they will have more income. They will use the extra income to send their children to school, because in the community where they live there are not many options as far as education is concerned.

loans.use: to convert her conventional coffee farm into an organic coffee farm

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia Maribel nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 30 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia Maribel trabaja en una entidad financiera y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone en su trabajo. La socia Maribel en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para hacer mantenimiento de la casa o sea desea comprar un repostero. 

La socia Maribel agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Member Maribel was born in the city of Cusco and resides in her native city. She is 30 years old and has a son. Maribel is a member of the "Latina Union" Communal Bank, which belongs to the Arariwa Association.

Maribel works in a financial institution and things are going very well due to the effort she puts into her work. On this occasion, she is seeking a loan to carry out maintenance on her house; specifically, she wishes to purchase a kitchen shelf unit.

Maribel is grateful for the loan and she is committed to complying with her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to make improvements on her house and buy a kitchen shelf unit.

loans.name: Nozanin

texts.en: Nozanin is a young and smart girl. She is taking her second course at the University. Nozanin is one of the clever students and is successful in all her assignments. She lives with her parents. They love Nozanin very much and are proud of her. She is asking for a loan to pay for her university studies. She is very hard-working and kind. If you help her she would be very happy.

loans.use: To pay for her studies at the university

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than (in the photo) is 39 years old and his wife, Sinuon is 38 years old. They live in a village about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children, two sons and three daughters. Two are garment workers, one attends school, and the other two are still young.  

Than and his wife are rice farmers and he also does construction work when he is not at the farm. Than is applying for his first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy a motorbike for his children to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his children to get to work.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Saren (pictured above), age 38, is a construction worker. His wife, Mady, age 30, is a garment worker. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh and they just have one young son. 

Saren is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,100 to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house.

loans.name: Srey Nan

texts.en:
Srey Nan, age 30, (in the photo), lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2001 and has just one young daughter. Her husband is a driver. 

Srey Nan sells grocery items and rice at her home. She hopes to expand her business by buying more rice for resale. Hence she is applying for a loan of $500 to help her.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for resale.

loans.name: Srey Chan

texts.en:
Srey Chan, age 31, is single and lives with her parents and brothers and sisters in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Srey Chan sells peanuts. She asks for a loan in the amount of $800 to help her sister who sells clothes. She will use money from the loan to buy additional clothes for resale.

loans.use: To help her sister to buy additional clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kisauni in the city of Mombasa. Her husband helps with her business. She started her fruit retailing business in 2006 by renting a counter in the market. Since she started the business, she has expanded her counter and gained many regular customers. 

Now that the dry season is approaching, she needs to increase her supplies in order to meet the market demand. In the future she planning to build her own house. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Since my business is the only income in the family, I need to make the best of it." She is requesting 50,000 KES to purchase more varieties of fruit in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell

loans.name: Felipe De Jesús

texts.es: De pequeño los abuelos de Felipe De Jesús le enseñaron a trabajar el café pero fue apenas hasta hace algunos años que comenzó a dedicarse a esta actividad al comprar un terreno, pues anteriormente trabajaba fuera de su lugar de origen. A Felipe De Jesús lo ayudan a trabajar en su finca su esposa María Elena y su 4 hijos, ellos se encargan de realizar todas las actividades desde chapeo, poda, preparar el terreno hasta la siembra y la cosecha. Durante el último año tuvieron una producción total de 7 toneladas la cual fue entregada a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco”, asociación a la cual está afiliado y que se encarga de procesar y exportar el café.
