Para el próximo año Felipe De Jesús tiene contemplado aumentar su producción a 9 toneladas pues ya sembró nueva plantas las cuales pronto comenzaran a dar fruto. Para poder alcanzar su meta necesita comprar fertilizantes y por eso está solicitando un crédito. Para poder darle mayor ingreso a su familia Felipe De Jesús trabaja como jornalero en las épocas que no hay mucho que hacer en las fincas pues tiene la ilusión de que algún día sus hijos puedan salir a estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: From the time he was very young,  Felipe De Jesús' grandparents taught him about growing coffee but it wasn't until a few years ago that he dedicated himself to this work and bought a field.  Before that he worked away from his home.  His wife, Maria Elena, as well as his four children help him with the farming.  They all handle everything, from thinning the seedlings, pruning, preparing the ground from the planting to the harvest.  Last year he had a total production of 7 tons which he delivered to the Unión Regional de Huatusco association of which he is a member.  They process and export the coffee.  For next year Felipe De Jesús is planning on producing 9 tons and he has already planted new seedlings which will soon bear fruit.  For this goal he needs to buy fertilizer and that is why he is requesting a loan.  To get more income for his family  Felipe De Jesús also works as a day laborer in the season when there is not much to do on the farms.  He has hopes that some day his children can study for university careers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plants

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is a married woman who lives with her husband and one child in Kisauni, Mombasa, Kenya. Her child studies at the lower primary school.

Using her business skills, Lyn started a garment retail business in 2010. Now her business activity and income are stable and improving steadily. Lyn is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activities by purchasing supplies in large quantities." The total amount she is requesting is 30,000 KES to buy more garments and install piped water in her family house.

loans.use: to buy more garments and install piped water in her family house.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur is a very kind and glorious man. He is very smart and always tries to find new ways of getting income. He likes to work in gardens. That’s why more than 20 years ago, he began to work in a garden. He is busy with growing fruit trees. 

He is also good with his family. He has three children and a lovely woman. In business, too, Bahodur helps his daughter. She also works hard and tries to develop her father’s deal. He wants to raise the level of his life. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing his house. Your kindness will make him very happy. He waits for your help.

loans.use: To repair his living house

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Ang is 40 years old, a humble mother who permanently lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is a mother of four children, all of whom are living independently. Ang owns and manages a rice farming business to support the family. She has been doing this business for almost 23 years. She works in this field alongside her supportive husband, earning around USD 4.00 each day. Aside from helping Ang in managing farm work, Ang’s husband is expert in constructing wooden houses, providing his services across the province with his team. 

Ang wants to make improvements to her farming business, so she decided to look for a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a couple of cows for farming purposes. This will help her reduce some of her operating expenses in the process of growing rice crops. In the following years, she plans to expand her business and own a larger plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows for farming purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en: Eleanor is 39 years old and married with children. Eleanor is a hardworking person who makes sure she can provide for all the needs of her family. Eleanor has managed a store for three years. She sells different products in the community. Eleanor is requesting a loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods and spices as additional products that she can offer in the community. She hopes that someday she can see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and spices for her store

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 21 years old, married and lives in the Philippines. 

Marlon is providing motorela, or motorcycle taxi, services. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services. 

Marlon has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Marlon hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a widow and has children. She cultivates her land to grow rice to sell. Mercedita works hard to support herself and her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Mercedita hopes to have a successful harvest. She also hopes to acquire more farm land in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Kisauni in Mombasa, Kenya, is a very commercial city. Because of this, the population is growing rapidly.

It is in this beautiful city of Mombasa that we find Joyce. She has made selling charcoal and firewood her full-time occupation to help her children and her husband, Oloo, get ahead. Oloo works every day as a mason.

Joyce works arduously as a charcoal and firewood vendor about six hours a day so that afterwards she can dedicate herself to her house and her beloved family.

Joyce applied to Yehu Microfinance in search of financing to stock charcoal and firewood. In this way, she intends to satisfy her customers not only with the best service but also with the products that they request. Joyce experiences a challenge of high competition, so she dreams of being able to extend her business to establish her first market stall with the goal of working more calmly, having more merchandise, and increasing sales. In this way, Joyce dreams of becoming a true entrepreneur, with the great desire of every day improving herself and giving the best to her family.

loans.use: to stock charcoal and firewood to resell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 47 years old, married and lives with her family in the village of Ilagan. For the last nine years, she has made a living by running a shop where she makes and sells doors, windows and kitchens. She has lots of experience in this field, a good reputation, and is well known in her area. Carolina is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy an additional aluminum-cutting machine and to make new items to sell. Her goal is to increase her profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and equipment for a metal shop.

loans.name: Kanyamakerre Tukwatanize Group

texts.en: Gertrude is a twenty-seven-year-old married woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children up to the university level. She began by operating a retail shop and she has now diversified her business to include cloth selling. Her main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation however she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets. Gertrude needs a loan to buy clothes, sugar, soap and salt for resale. She is wearing a yellow cloth and is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a fifty-five-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling beer and soft drinks for fifteen years. He started with five million shillings and now has thirty million shillings as working capital. 

His hardships are taxes, customers not paying on time, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is expanding the business into new markets. Robert wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.en:
Margarito is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has five children. Margarito has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. He has had this business for 11 years. 

He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Margarito has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Margarito hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Yofesi

texts.en:
Yofesi is a 39-year-old man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For twelve years, he has been running a carpentry workshop. He started by using his own trees on his land. He made furniture and sold it. After accumulating enough capital, he decided to buy timber from others to make more furniture. Now, Yofesi wants a loan to buy timber for furniture making.

Yofesi faces problems of customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. He would like to educate his children and expand his business to other areas.

loans.use: to buy timber and make furniture for sale.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Annabel has a mini-store that sells beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of beverages to sell.

Annabel became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Annabel hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of beverages to resell

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda  is  42  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Rosenda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5  years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Rosenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rosenda hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
60-year-old Pedro is a married man with three adult children. He is a farmer and owns farmland in San Miguel, Bohol. Pedro cultivates his land planting rice crops. His harvest goes to family consumption and selling. 

Pedro works hard to keep his crops healthy and achieve an abundant harvest. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Pedro hopes to acquire more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman and lives in Kisauni, Mombasa City. She has three children, all of whom attend school.

Khadija has a coconut selling store. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan to buy additional coconuts for her store for resale.

Khadija has been a member of Yehu Microfinance for two years. In the future, Khadija hopes to improve her family's living conditions by using her profit.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Naomi bought sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and onions as well as other fresh vegetables. She sold these items, increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because her sellers have requested more products, as they have an established clientele, and Naomi's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why her Kiva loan will be successful: because she will respond to demand by buying fruits and vegetables at a good price from the harvest. She will also buy a refrigerator to store perishable products. Naomi tells the lenders that her Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may they continue helping her.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables at a good price from the harvest, as well as a refrigerator.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Marissa has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Marissa became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Marissa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.en:
Bunafsha is very beautiful and purposeful woman. She is cute, good-natured, and plodding. 

For more than three years, she has owned a business. She is busy with sewing covers for cars. Bunafsha’s business has been developing day by day as she knows her work very well. She has a friendly family. She has two children and a kind husband. 

In business, she has nobody to help because she is the owner of the business. She wants to develop her business further. That’s why she is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine for expanding her business. She waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for developing her business

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Albina has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Albina became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 26 years old and is a married woman with one child who is two years and six months old. Her husband works in a certain insurance company. 

She has had a stationery shop for two years now. She sells stationery such as office pins, printing paper, and toner. She is thankful to her husband, who provides her with support through his salary. Esther works hard to increase her income, as she plans to save for her child's education. 

She has requested a loan to buy toner, printing paper, and books to stock in her shop. This will help increase Esther's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy toner, printing paper, and books

loans.name: Lucio Dagoberto

texts.es:
El socio Lucio nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio Lucio trabaja en una entidad privada de seguros de vida y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone en su trabajo. El socio Lucio en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para hacer mantenimiento de la casa o sea desea comprar mayólica, puertas, sanitarios y otras cosas más. Sueño del socio Lucio es abrir una inmobiliaria. 

El socio Lucio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Lucio was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the city in which he was born.  He is 51 years old, married and has three children from this beautiful relationship.  He belongs to Asociación Arariwa's “Unión Latina” community bank.

Lucio works for a private live assurance company and things are going very well for him thanks to the hard work that he puts in to his job.  On this occasion, Lucio is requesting a loan to carry out some work on his house.  He would like to buy tiles, doors, bathroom fittings and other items.  His dream is to open a real estate agency.

Lucio is grateful for his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to carry out some work on his home

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia Eulogia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 44 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia Eulogia se dedica los que haceres de la casa pero también se dedica a alquilar vehículos que sirven para brindar servicio de transporte urbano. La socia Eulogia es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora y responsable que saca adelante a su familia y gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación le va muy bien. La socia Eulogia en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para hacer mantenimiento de los carros o sea desea comprar llantas. 

La socia Eulogia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Eulogia was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city in which she was born.  She is 44 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have four children.  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Unión Latina” community bank.

Eulogia does her housework but also hires out vehicles which people use to provide an urban transport service.

Eulogia is an entrepreneurial, tenacious, responsible woman who provides for her family.  Thanks to her hard work and commitment, things are going very well.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to have maintenance work carried out on her cars.  She would like to buy tires.

Eulogia is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on her cars.  To buy tires.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a hardworking, enterprising person. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, she has been able to better stock her store with all the items she needed. She is once again asking for a loan from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance so she can buy rice, pasta, sugar, and drinks at wholesale prices. In this way, she will have a well-stocked store and will earn more money. Amina is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for providing this new opportunity.

loans.use: To  purchase buy rice, pasta, sugar, and drinks at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and assorted drinks

loans.name: Romualda

texts.en:
Romualda is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 62 years old and is married with eight children. Three of her children are school-aged and are under her care. Romualda and her husband are both farmers. She helps plant rice on their land and sell their harvest at the market.

Romualda is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. She hopes to have sufficient income to expand their farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a very enterprising woman. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva she has been able to better stock her store with all the items she needed. She is once again asking for a loan from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance so she can buy utensils, rice, pasta, sugar and drinks to establish a restaurant business. In this way she will have a well-stocked store and will earn more money. Habiba is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for providing this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy utensils, rice, pasta, sugar and drinks to establish a restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 60 years old and married. He does livestock farming to earn a living. Besides that, he also generates extra income from his rental houses. He has been in the business for eleven years and has one employee. Previously, he acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him expand his business. He hopes to construct more houses in the future. He needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy iron sheets and cement to construct more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a married woman with three children ages 22, 24 and 25. Her husband is a fisherman. Teofila is involved in seaweed farming. She sells dried and fresh seaweed. She also helps her husband sell his catch at their town's market. Teofila works hard to help provide for her family's basic needs.

Teofila is requesting a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and gasoline. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and gasoline

loans.name: Mathy

texts.en:
This is Mathy. She is 50 years old and is a resident of Intramuros, which is in Manila, Philippines. She is married to Bienvinido, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mathy sells processed meat products. What she basically does is buy processed meat products from a wholesaler. Then she sells the products by the piece or pack at a profit. Products can include ham, hot dogs, processed pork, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 pesos. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more and a greater variety of processed food products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mathy dreams of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also wants to have her own permanent stall. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of frozen and processed food needed in her business.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Benjie provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the service.

Benjie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Benjie hopes to improve his services to help with the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 35 years old. She is a private school proprietor in Miritini, Mombasa. She is married and she has been running this business for the past eight years. Her business is doing great.

This is Linda’s third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to construct more classrooms and buy new desks. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and improve her school. 


She hopes to have the most well-known school in the coast province.

loans.use: to construct more classrooms and buy new desks

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a thirty-four-year-old hardworking woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.She has a personal goal of building a permanent home. She has a retail shop and she started with capital of three hundred thousand UGX and now has over five hundred thousand shillings as working capital. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the high demand and her vision is expanding her business to new areas.

Lydia needs a loan to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil  to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 52 years old and a retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. She is a married mother of four. Her business has been in operation for the past two years and it is doing great.

This marks her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more cooking oil, sugar, salt and rice. She will use the proceeds to expand her shop further. 

She hopes to have a prosperous and happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, sugar, salt and rice.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Amor has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Amor became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Amor hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan  is  35  years old, single and lives in the Philippines. Alan  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. He had this business for seven  years. He requested a loan for  5,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  

Alan  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Alan hopes to improve his business for the education of his nephew.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Kitombo

texts.en:
Kitombo is a 49-year-old hawker of assorted goods in Mikindani, Mombasa. He is married and  a father of two children. He has done this business for a period of eight years and he is doing great. He earns a monthly income of nineteen thousand eight hundred shillings. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his fifth loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase more wristwatches, torches, basins, key holders and knives. 

He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a motorbike to aid him in transporting his goods with ease. He hopes to have a big profitable business that will enable him to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more wristwatches, torches, basins, key holders and knives.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 54 years old, and he is a retail shop owner in Mariakani. He is a married father of three school-going children. He has been a shopkeeper for the past six years.  His business is doing great.

This marks his fifth loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergents. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further and to repay his loan. 

He hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergents

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline used her previous loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes to resell. She also used part of the loan to to renovate her salon. She testifies that through Faulu Kenya, she has become a better business-lady because she has been trained in business management. She hopes that one day, she will open other outlets of her salon business. She has requested another loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is 35 years old and a mother of five children. Three of them are studying while her remaining children stay at home since Nazia can't educate them due to financial constraints.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver while she supports her family by sewing clothes. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to repair his auto-rickshaw. By doing that, he will be able to run his business better and provide improved transportation services to his passengers.

He has been operating his business for many years. Nazia is hopeful that the loan will help her husband make more money from his business, and she will also be able to send her remaining children to school in the near future.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw for her husband's rickshaw transport business

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is a Kisauni resident who works selling fruit, tubers, and vegetables. With the loan she is requesting, she hopes to better organize her business by buying baskets for displaying her fruits and a larger, more presentable table than the one she has. She also wants to increase the variety of the products she offers at this time.

She started out selling fruit six years ago. So, with time, the business continued becoming stronger and attracting more customers all the time. But that was not enough for Tumaini; recognizing that her business was very strategically located, she decided to take advantage of that. 

Tumaini has her family's help in staffing her business; for that reason, her biggest dream is to continue growing and eventually have a large store that can accommodate everyone and earn greater profits to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy baskets for displaying her fruits

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli  is  31  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Araceli  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5  years. She requested a loan for  5,000  PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Araceli  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Araceli hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger  is  38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. Roger  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. He had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.  

Roger  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Roger hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Arng's Group

texts.en:
Arng is a villager of Moung Russey district in which rice farming is a common business to earn a living. She is 33 years old and also a mother of three children. Not different from the majority of the villagers, she grows paddy rice on her two-hectare of farmland as the main source of income. Moreover, she and her husband also work for others for pay for extra income for her family's sake. She has been with her current business for 10 years and she can earn about 14,400 KHR per day. However, the shortage of water supply for her rice farm remains the main challenge for her family. 

This is the first cycle for Arng while it is the second cycle for her group member. She and her co-member are requesting a loan of 300,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for farmland and she hopes to grow her rice healthily so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Cuando Vicente tenía 20 años se compró un terreno para poder producir café, pues desde pequeño su padre le enseñó a trabajar con este cultivo a él y sus hermanos. Actualmente Vicente tiene 77 años y está casado desde hace más de medio siglo con Celestina y tienen 4 hijos quienes les ayudan a trabajar en los cafetales haciendo labores de todo tipo, desde la limpieza hasta la cosecha. El café que ellos producen es totalmente orgánico ya que no utiliza fertilizantes que contengan productos químicos pues dañan el medio ambiente. Vicente está solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar planta de café para renovar sus fincas y además necesita hacer labores de limpieza. Durante la última cosecha tuvo una producción de 7 toneladas y si lleva a cabo la renovación podría llegar a producir dentro de 2 años un total de 10 toneladas. Vicente tiene como metas personales a futuro ampliar su casa para que puedan vivir más cómodamente él y su esposa Celestina, además quieren mayor espacio para cuando los van a visitar sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en: When Vicente was 20 years old he bought a plot of land so that he could produce coffee because his father had taught him and his siblings how to work with this crop since he was young.  Vicente is currently 77 years old.  He has been married to Celestina for more than half a century.  The couple have four children who help them work in their coffee fields, carrying out all kinds of tasks from weeding to harvesting.  The coffee that they produce is totally organic.  They do not use fertilizers that contain chemical products because they harm the environment.  Vicente is requesting a loan as he needs to buy coffee plants so that he can renew his fields.  He also needs to carry out weeding work.  During his last harvest, Vicente produced 7 tons of coffee.  If he carries out this renewal work, he will be able to produce a total of 10 tons within two years.  Vicente's personal goal for the future is to extend his home so that he and his wife Celestina can live more comfortably.  They would also like to have more space for when their children and grandchildren come to visit.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants to renew his fields

loans.name: Chia's Group

texts.en:
Chia is a young Iraqi mother. She is married and together with her husband, raising two small children. As the family grew, Chia started to use her skills to help support the family. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Chia is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has three years' experience with the little business, successfully meeting the demands of both the household chores and the sewing/tailoring activity.

With a previous Relief International - Microfinance Iraq loan, Chia purchased an overlock machine. And after finishing repayments on the first loan, she has now decided to use a new loan to make further investments and improvements. She would now like to replace her regular sewing machine and purchase some small furniture items for her work area as well as a small generator which will allow her to work during the hours the city's power is out.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to replace her sewing machine and purchase some small furniture items and a small generator

loans.name: Huoth

texts.en:
Huoth is a 47-year-old married woman who has been residing with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She, as well as other local villagers, operates a farming business to generate income for the family. She does her farm work based on traditional methods and still uses animal’s strength to maintain her business. She grows seasonal crops for sale such as rice and potatoes. Huoth is responsible for five single children, two of whom are employed in Phnom Penh city.

She has owned two cows but they are getting too old, so she will sell them to local traders and buy two strong cows for her farm work. Due to insufficient funds, Huoth would like to ask for a loan of USD 900 to purchase a couple of cows. Huoth hopes to improve her business through using the loan from lenders. In the future, she intends to expand her business, renovate her house, and at least help her children finish their studies at high school level.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of cows for farm work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Gioconda, sigue con sus ventas de cosméticos, vendiendo al crédito y al contado producto Avon y Zermat, también trabaja medio tiempo como conserje, teniendo ingresos fijos, lo que se ah  apoyado mucho, siendo madre soltera.
Es atreves de financiamiento que ha introducido más mercadería, aumentando sus ventas, lo que logra cubrir los gastos de su familia, con este nuevo préstamo es para seguir comprando  cosméticos como: cremas de cuerpo, vanidad, maquillaje, pinturas de labios, perfume de dama y caballero, tintes, cremas de mancha, y ropa de encargo, siendo lo más demandado por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gioconda continues selling cosmetics.  She sells Avon and Zermat products on credit and for cash.  She also works part time as a caretaker.  This makes her a fixed income and has supported her a lot as she is a single mother.

Through her loans, Gioconda has managed to introduce more merchandise, increase her sales and cover her family expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more cosmetics such as body lotions, beauty products, make-up, lipsticks, men's and women's perfumes, dyes, vanishing cream and clothing.  These are the products that she has most demand for.

loans.use: to buy creams, men's and women's perfumes, and clothing

loans.name: Sabriya's Group

texts.en:
Sabriya is a successful, proud, independent Iraqi businesswoman with 22 years' experience making and selling Iraqi sweets. She is 48 years old, divorced and a mother of two children.   

She is a hardworking role model to her children and she is continuously improving her store to provide the best for her customers. The improvements are also required by law, as the production site must meet all requirements and regulations for bakeries to be licensed. In the past, she has already taken a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to renew her shop and work area, and she is now taking a new loan to continue making the required improvements. With the loan, she will be able to bring the shop once again to the standard level required by law.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to improve her sweets shop and meet the standards required by regulations

loans.name: Sherifa

texts.en:
Sherifa is 32 years old and is a tailor in Mombasa. She is single. She has been sewing clothes for her customers for the past five years. Her business is doing great. 

This is Sherifa’s second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a new motorbike to start a transportation business. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her businesses further and repay her loan. She hopes to have a financially stable life.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel es productor de café desde hace más de 30 años. Sus inicios fueron ayudando a su padre a trabajar en la finca familiar y con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo todos los secretos relacionados con este cultivo. Él siempre ha trabajado en el campo, en ocasiones para otras personas y la mayoría de las veces en su propio terreno. Aunque conoce acerca de la producción de varios tipos de cultivo como caña, maíz, frijol y naranja entre otros el café es el que mejores resultados le ha dado y durante la última cosecha produjo en total de 5 toneladas las cuales vendió a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” donde fueron procesadas y exportadas. Gabriel necesita en estos momentos de un crédito para comprar fertilizantes y planta de café, pues tiene 2000 plantas y quiere comprar otras 500. Con la compra de fertilizante su producción aumentará a 6 toneladas y con la compra de planta en 2 años estará produciendo unas 7 toneladas en total. A Gabriel lo ayudan a trabajar en su finca sus 4 hijos mientras que su esposa Hortencia se ocupa de las labores del hogar. La mayor preocupación de Gabriel y su esposa es poder brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de superarse y salir adelante ya que en la comunidad en la que viven no hay muchas oportunidades de educación ni de empleo.
texts.en: Gabriel has been a coffee producer for more than thirty years.  He started out helping his father work on the family farm.  Over time, he learned all the secrets of working with this crop.  Gabriel has always worked on the land, sometimes for other people but most often on his own land.  Although he knows a lot about producing a number of different types of crops such as sugarcane, corn, beans and oranges, coffee is the crop that has given him the best results.  During his last harvest he produced a total of 5 tons which he sold to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” who processed them and exported them.  Right now, Gabriel needs a loan to buy fertilizers and coffee plants.  He has 2,000 plants and would like to buy another 500.  With the purchase of the fertilizer, his production will increase to 6 tons and, with the purchase of the plants, he will be producing a total of 7 tons in two years time.  Gabriel's four children help him work in his fields while his wife, Hortencia, takes care of the housework.  Gabriel and his wife's biggest concern is to provide their children with an opportunity to do well in life and make progress because there are not many opportunities for education or work in the community in which they live.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Fryal's Group

texts.en:
Fryal is a 35-year-old Iraqi woman who is raising her child alone since her divorce. She is an independent, strong woman, but with limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has six years' experience in making custom-ordered dresses and small fabric household items. She would like to offer new products, create products with unique designs for her customers, and give them improved quality products. She has decided to purchase an overlock sewing machine, an iron, and quality fabrics and raw materials for the little business. To be able to make these purchases, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine, an iron, and quality fabrics and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spirits, beers and fizzy drinks to be able to meet all his client needs.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es:
Isaac trabaja como mayordomo en una finca en su municipio, y allí le permiten tener ganado propio para la venta, ahorrando los gastos de mantenimiento. Esto le ha permitido tener unos ingresos extras con lo que su familia puede gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Isaac tiene 3 hijos de 3, 7 y 11 años de edad a quienes siempre les quiere brindar una educación de buena calidad, por esto trabaja fuertemente todos los días para que sus hijos sigan teniendo el acceso a la educación, pues es una de las grandes dificultades económicas del hogar ya que la escuela queda muy retirada y debe pagar transporte todos los días para llevarlos y recogerlos. Con su negocio Isaac ha logrado tener una gran cantidad de clientes los cuales le hacen grandes pedidos, por esto ahora que tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos por parte de sus clientes busca un préstamo que le permita comprar ganado para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera superará la dificultad de capital para surtir su negocio y así seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es sacar su familia adelante brindándoles una buena calidad de vida y a sus hijos en un futuro poderles brindar educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Isaac works as a foreman on a ranch in his town and they allow him to keep his own cattle there.  This saves him money on maintenance expenses and has given him extra income so that his family can enjoy a better quality of life and more financial opportunities to make progress.  Isaac has three children who are 3, 7 and 11 years old.  He has always wanted to ensure they have a good education and he works hard every day so that they continue having access to education.  This is one of the biggest financial difficulties for his family because the school is very far away and he has to pay for transportation every day to take them to school and bring them home again.  Isaac has managed to attract a large number of customers who place large orders with him.  He is looking to take out a loan so that he can buy cattle and fill the orders he has.

In this way, Isaac will be able to overcome his financial difficulties and stock his business.  This will allow him to continue providing his customers with a good service.  His biggest dream is to provide for his family and offer them a good quality of life.  He also dreams of being able to offer his children the chance to study at university in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle so that he can fill some orders

loans.name: Hunar's Group

texts.en:
Hunar is a hardworking 22-year-old Iraqi man. He is married and has a child. To support his family, he is running an auto repair and maintenance garage, specializing in such work as changing oil and oil filters. With four years' experience, he has established a good reputation and has many returning customers visiting his garage who are satisfied with the quality of the services they receive. 

Hunar is continuously on the lookout for new developments, making sure he can provide great quality work on all car models, even the newest ones. He has already taken out a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq in the past, which he used to renovate the garage. After successful repayment of his first loan, he decided to continue to invest in his business and took out a new loan to purchase quality tools for the auto repair shop. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and, thereby, unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase quality tools for an auto repair garage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replace her sewing machine and her overlock sewing machine and also buy nice, quality fabrics and raw materials

loans.name: Victor Isidro

texts.es: Víctor tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también a la cría de gallinas, es una familia muy luchadora y honrada. Víctor se dedica al cultivo de café y aprendió del oficio gracias a su padre desde hace 20 años se dedica a esta actividad, el horario laboral es de 6:00 am a 1:00 pm el negocio del cultivo de café  en ciertas temporadas resulta ser muy rentable para Víctor ya que el cuenta con muy buenos clientes que le pagan a un buen precio su producto, la desventaja es que la producción solo se da una vez al año. Víctor solicita este préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, ya que lo necesita para el mejoramiento de la finca y así poder obtener una buena cosecha. El mayor deseo de Víctor es mejorar la instalación física de su finca para aumentar sus ganancias y así mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este es su cuarto préstamo en FAMA y ha cumplido puntualmente con el compromiso de sus pagos.
texts.en:
Víctor is 35, married, and has three children. His wife does the household chores and also raises chickens.  This is an honest family that constantly strives to get ahead. 

Victor grows coffee, and leaned this trade thanks to his father who has been in this business for 20 years. His work day is from 6:00am to 1:00pm. In certain seasons the coffee-growing business proves very profitable for Victor, as he has good customers who pay him a good price for his product. The disadvantage is that the harvest only occurs once a year.

Víctor is applying for this loan in order to buy fertilizers and pay for labor, as he needs it to improve his small farm and to be able to obtain a good harvest. 

Victor's greatest wish is to improve his farm's physical setup, in order to improve his earnings and the finances of his household.

This is his fourth loan with Fama, and he has been on time in meeting his payment commitments.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: La primera vez que Isaac visitó una finca de café fue a la edad de 10 años pues acompañó a su padre para ayudarlo a trabajar. Desde pequeño se interesó en todo lo relacionado con este cultivo y con el tiempo fue aprendiendo todo lo necesario para su producción. Actualmente Isaac está casado con Inocencia desde hace más de 50 años y tienen 5 hijos a los cuales desde pequeños les inculcó el amor por el trabajo en el campo y aunque ya están casados ayudan a Isaac en los trabajos necesarios en la finca de café. Isaac y su esposa producen alrededor de 8 toneladas de café orgánico por año. Él sabe que con la ayuda de un crédito podrá estar produciendo en un lapso de 5 años un total de 20 toneladas anuales, pues cuenta con terreno suficiente para sembrar más planta de café, sin embargo no cuenta con el recurso económico necesario para poder alcanzar esta meta. El mayor orgullo de Isaac y su esposa es poder haberle dado a sus hijos propiedades para que pudieran comenzar a trabajar por su cuenta y lo único que les falta por cumplir apoyar al menor de ellos para que pueda estudiar la carrera de ingeniería mecánica.
texts.en: The first time Isaac visited a coffee plantation was at the age of 10 when he accompanied his father to help him work.   Isaac has been interested in everything to do with this crop from a young age and, over time, he has learned everything he needs to know about growing it.  Isaac has been married to Inocencia for more than 50 years and they have five children in whom they have instilled a love for farm work from an early age.  Although they are already married, they help Isaac with the work on his coffee plantation.  Isaac and his wife produce around 8 tons of organic coffee a year.  He knows that, with the help of a loan, he will be able to produce a total of 20 tons a year in five years time because he has enough land to sow more coffee plants.  However, he doesn't have the money he needs to achieve this goal.  Isaac and his wife are really proud of the fact that they have been able to give their children property so that they can start working for themselves.  The only goal they still have to achieve is to support their youngest child so that he can study for a degree in mechanical engineering.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Parwin's Group

texts.en:
Parwin is a 66 years old and is an experienced Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of four children. Like many Iraqi women, she learned to sew at a young age and with limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. 

She has 23 years' experience with the little business activity, and she takes pride in her traditional quality works. She would like to make some improvements to the services she can offer, and would also like to improve her own work atmosphere. She took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to renew her work area and buy an overlock sewing machine and some nice quality fabrics and raw materials. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to renew her work area and buy an overlock sewing machine and some nice quality fabrics and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida is a 49-year-old married Iraqi woman. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Farida is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. 

She has five years' experience with the little business activity and would like to improve her work area and buy an overlock sewing machine to provide her customers with improved quality of work and a better variety of services. To be able to make these purchases, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers have been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work area and buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Feliza has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Feliza became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Feliza hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Marissa has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Marissa became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Marissa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Iyunge Group

texts.fr:
Evelyne fait partie du groupe Iyunge  et habite à Cibitoke. Elle  a  20 ans et est mariée à Bernard, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant, âgé de  45 jours.

Elle  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…) depuis 2 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…) à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  voir son commerce prospéré et voir son enfant en bonne santé.
texts.en:
Evelyne is a member of the Iyunge Group and lives in Cibitoke.  She is 20 years old and married to Bernard, a farmer.  The couple have one child who is 45 days old.  

Evelyne has been running a store selling rice, beans, salt, etc. for two years.  This is her second loan from Turame.  She will use her Kiva loan to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of items for her store (rice, beans, salt, etc.)  She will re-sell these goods and earn more money.

In the coming years, Evelyne would like to see her business prosper and see her son remain healthy.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of items to re-sell in her store (rice, beans, salt, etc.)

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is involved in agriculture. She operates a small farm behind her house, where she grows potatoes and beans. Anahit also has a small farm in a neighboring village, Aghavnadzor (18 kilometers away from Kapan), where she raises cattle. Currently, she keeps three cows. As the potato and bean harvest goes to sustain the family, the main part of the agricultural income comes from cattle breeding. Anahit sells not only the milk she gets, but also the cheese and matsun (thick sour milk) she makes from it. Anahit has applied for this loan to purchase a cow and a calf. This will help her to get more milk and make and sell more products. 

Anahit lives with her husband and son. Anahit's husband works at a local military unit, and her son is a constructor. Additional income from agriculture is important for the family to accumulate savings for renovation of their old house and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a calf

loans.name: Gs Los Amigos Ii Group

texts.es:
El señor Nelson de 38 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus dos hijos en su casa en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras. Don Nelson se dedica desde hace 7 años al negocio de compra venta de achinería.
Don Nelson esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar más producto como ser: pastas, controles para TV, linternas, focos ahorradores, y otras achinerías para la venta, con el préstamo surtirá más el negocio y venderá más y esto mejora su ingreso diario que le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Nelson es el líder del grupo los Amigos II, don Omar que también se dedica a la venta de achinería de manera ambulante y don Edilberto se dedica a la venta ambulante de achinería.
Ellos todos los días viajan de San Lorenzo a la frontera de El Salvador a vender sus productos, se han destacado por ser buenos clientes humildes y laboriosos y con mucho entusiasmo por salir adelante.
El sueño de todos ellos es mejorar sus negocios y sus viviendas.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2012
texts.en:
Nelson is 38, and lives with his partner and his two children in their home in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. Nelson has been in the business of buying and selling knick-knacks for seven years.

Nelson is requesting the loan to buy more product such as shoe polish, TV remote controls, flashlights, and other knickknacks to sell. With the loan he will buy additional stock for his business, sell more, and improve his daily income; which will help him improve his quality of life.

Nelson is the leader of the "Amigos II" group, with Omar and Edilbrto who both sell knick-knacks as street vendors.

Every day they travel from San Lorenzo to the El Salvador border in order to sell their products.  They stand out as good clients: modest and hard-working, with much enthusiasm for getting ahead in life.

All of them dream of improving their businesses and their homes.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo 2012

loans.use: To buy shoe polish, TV remote controls, flashlights, energy-saving light bulbs, and other knick-knacks to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa, 56, a resident of Intramuros in Manila. She is married to Manuel, a traffic enforcer. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elsa operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it, making a little profit. Her products are decorative plastic flowers, plants, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more decorative plastic flowers and plants to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elsa hopes to expand soon. She dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She also dreams of having her own house and lot someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of decorative plastic flowers and plants needed in her business.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
(La señora Martha está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Martha nació en la ciudad de Yucay pero vive en la hermosa provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de socia Martha es la agricultura pues se dedica a venta de verduras y vende sus productos en diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco y Urubamba. Ya son 28 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Martha requiere el préstamo para comprar  semillas, ferlizantes y abono.  

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Angeles de Urubamba” en la provincia del Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de verduras, venta de medicamentos y albañil.   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
(Sra. Martha is the woman in the photo with her hand up.)  Our member, Martha, was born in the city of Yucay but she lives in Urubamba, a beautiful province in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She is 54-years old, married and has three children.  She operates a farming business.  She grows vegetables and sells them in various markets in Cusco and Urubama.  She has operated the business for 28 years and says that the business has been a good source of income.  Martha is applying for a loan that she will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and organic manure.

The members of the "Angeles de Urubamba" community bank are friends and neighbors, all of whom live in Urubamba province.  The members look for every opportunity to get ahead and they work hard so that they can provide better futures for their children.  They operate a range of businesses: food sales, herbal medicine sales and construction work.  

The members tell us that they are grateful for the help your loans provide and that they are committed to repaying the loans in the agreed-upon time.

The city of Cusco was founded by the Incas.  The city lies in Cusco district which, in turn, is in the "departamento" of Cusco.  Tourists flock to the city to see its historic center, nearby archaelogical sites and the countryside around the city.  It's considered one of the most charming cities in southern Peru.  Cusco is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and for one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Winston

texts.en:
Winston is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Winston is providing multi-cab services. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Winston became a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, Winston hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen helps to support her family by doing embroidery and sewing clothing. She is highly skilled in the art of embroidery. She and her husband have three sons and a daughter. Their daughter, 24 years old and unmarried, still lives at home. Their sons are employed.

Nasreen’s husband runs a milk and yogurt selling business. His shop is in the busiest area of the city and he makes reasonably good profits from his business.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her husband’s milk and yogurt selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy milk in larger quantities to make more yogurt, which he can then sell to his clients for more profits.

Nasreen is hopeful that she will be able to collect some dowry for her daughter’s marriage with the improved income of her husband.

loans.use: to buy milk for the milk and yogurt sales business

loans.name: Heri

texts.en:
Heri is a married woman with a family. She lives with her five children and her partner in the town of Mombasa, very close to the sea. Since she was very young she has made a living selling fruit, motivated by her father and sister who make their living in the same way, selling not only fruit but also vegetables and tubers. 

On seeing that this was going well, she rented a small stall in the public market where she also offered a variety of fruit such as papaya, blackberries, mango, ripe bananas and little oranges, among other tropical fruits. She did well with this and acquired many clients, strengthening her business. However, since the year 2010 she has started to work in a private business in the business center, due to which she has had to move the business into her home.

She buys every three days in the public market but sometimes her clients request a greater variety of fruit, which for want of capital she can't provide. With the first loan from Yehu Microfinance she intends to acquire them. With the fruit of her labor she wants to help her family get ahead and to have her own house very soon—she is already saving for it. Heri feels very fortunate for all that she has achieved and the opportunities that life has given her.

loans.use: to buy papaya, blackberries, mango, ripe bananas and little oranges

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a married woman living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business, selling items such as snacks, toiletries, spices and canned goods. She is able to support her family's daily needs. 

Cristita works hard to increase her sales and income. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods and toiletries. Cristita hopes for her family to be in good health always and for her business to improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods and toiletries

loans.name: Bricsio

texts.en:
Bricsio is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Bricsio sells copra in their local community. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of coconuts used in making copra.

Bricsio has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Bricsio hopes to improve his business for the education of his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts used in making copra

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en:
Hilder is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from her clothes selling business. She sells various merchandise, such as women's dresses, sleepwear, perfumes, and cosmetics, which she delivers to each customer according to what she has ordered from her. She sells on credit and gets back her investment weekly, biweekly, or monthly depending on the agreement with her customer. 

Hilder started working as a merchant four years ago. As she wants to continually improve her businesses, her working capital is no longer sufficient, especially during times when her business turnover increases, during weddings. This is why she has sought out a Kiva loan through her first financing experience with Yehu Microfinance. With it, she will buy merchandise, such as elegant dresses and shoes, to fill her customers' orders and make sure they are well dressed for weddings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as elegant dresses and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tools to use in the repair shop

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco y sus hermanos comenzaron desde pequeños a trabajar con su padre en las fincas de café y con el paso del tiempo fueron aprendiendo nuevas técnicas de cultivo las cuales hacen más sencillo el trabajo y genera una mayor producción. Él tiene 53 años, está casado con Virgilia y tienen 4 hijos a los cuales también ha enseñado a trabajar en el campo, ya que la zona en donde viven no cuenta con otras fuentes de empleo. Francisco necesita de un crédito para comprar fertilizante para sus fincas ya que quiere aumentar su producción la cual fue de 10.5 toneladas y media durante la última cosecha. En base a su experiencia sabe que está podría llegar hasta 13 toneladas en el próximo año. Él entrega toda su cosecha a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que sea exportada. En un futuro a él le gustaría emprender otra actividad, sin descuidar el café; como lo es la producción de nuez de macadamia para de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos y su patrimonio.
texts.en: Francisco and his brothers started working with their father when they were just boys.  They farmed coffee and, over time, learned new ways to farm that made their jobs easier and increased their yields.  Francisco, 53, and his wife, Virgilia, have 4 children.  The children, too, have learned farming, the only source of employment here.  Francisco is applying for a loan that he will use to buy fertilizer for his farm.  He wants to increase production from his next crop to something more than the 10.5 tons that he produced last time.  He knows that he can produce something closer to 13 tons next year.  Francisco delivers his crop to the "Union Regional de Huatusco" cooperative which, in turn, sometimes exports it to other countries.  For the future, he would like start another business that he can operate alongside his coffee business.  He is considering producing macadamia nuts as a means to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Mirna Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Mirna, sigue con mucha fortaleza, trabajando en su  negocio de venta de ropa, cosmético y electrodomésticos, el cual solo los trae por encargo este último producto, ya que son más caros. Lleva veinte años comercializando, ayudando  ah sus hijos en la educación. Hoy en día, casados, contando con el apoyo de ellos, siendo separada de su esposo.
Para ella el financiamiento ha sido muy bueno, ya que ha logrado mantener su pequeño negocio, invertido más en productos,  a si como las mejoras que ha hecho en su casa.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de: ropa, cosméticos y zapatos, ya que tiene poco, y son de mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Mirna is still working, with great fortitude, in her business selling clothing, cosmetics and home appliances. The latter product she only brings in when people order them, as they are more expensive.

She has been selling for 20 years, helping her children with their education. Now they are married, and she relies on their support, as she is separated from her husband.

The loan has been very good for her, as she has managed to keep her small business going, continuing to invest in products, as well as in the improvements she has done to her house.

With this new loan she will buy clothing, cosmetics and shoes, as she has little of these, and there is great demand for them.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, age 47, runs a sari-sari (general store) business. In her shop, she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has operated her business for three years. Lydia and her husband have nine children. 

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 

In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business in order to secure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Jovencio

texts.en:
Jovencio is a married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has two children ages 8 and 11. He has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business for six years. 

Jovencio works hard to provide for his family's needs and to send his children to school. He has requested a loan to pay for tune-up service and purchase motorcycle spare parts. Jovencio hopes for this loan to help improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for tune-up service and purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Alily

texts.en:
Alily  is  58  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Alily  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 28  years. She requested a loan for  30,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Alily  has been a member of HSPFI since 1999. In the future, Alily hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
As the breadwinner of the family residing in the Dambae district of Battambang Province, Mon has to be responsible for two children who are still in school. To feed her family, she has been working for 7 years on one hectare of farmland each for growing rice and cassava.  From these current businesses, she can earn up to 5 US Dollars per day. For her, the main challenges are children's illness and the insufficiency of working capital for her farmland.

Mon has just joined VisionFund this cycle as a first-cycle client. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and hire laborers for plowing her land for both cash-crops. She hopes she still can keep both of her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire laborers for plowing her land for growing rice and cassava

loans.name: Matano

texts.en: Matano is a married man and he runs a plumbing business. He lives in a municipality located a very short distance from Mombasa with his wife and their five children. For this reason, 20 years ago he started with a few plumbing tools, gradually adding one more machine as his market was expanding. He is currently requesting his first loan to Yehu Microfinance to buy electric tools to tend to the requests for this service that he gets. His activity has a significant potential for growth to make the most of, as his neighborhood is expanding.

loans.use: to buy electric tools for plumbing

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liwayway is 56 years old and has two children who are in school.

Liwayway has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Liwayway requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Liwayway has been in this business for five years. In the future, Liwayway would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina aprendió de niña gracias a su padre a producir café aunque dejó esta actividad por algunos años.
