He gets the supplies to do his work in the city that is closest to his house.  It is one hour away, and he needs to walk and then get on a bus.  In his community there is no taxi service.

He will use the loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo to buy fertilizers, fungicides, and herbicides for his corn crops.  He will also buy three “quintales”  [a quintal is about 100 pounds] of iron for his job as a blacksmith.  He also works making machetes.

This way he will get a good production to later sell for a good price.  He will also sell the machetes.  He will do this in order to give his daughter everything she needs for her growth and development.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides, and herbicides for his corn crops.  He will also buy three “quintales”  [a quintal is about 100 pounds] of iron for his job as a blacksmith.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Don Oscar tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y procreo tres hijos, pero todos ellos ya han formado su propio hogar. Él tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la crianza y venta de ganado bovino, actividad que siempre la ha ejercido. Actualmente posee cuatro reces. Además, se dedica a la agricultura como lo es a la siembra de maíz, maicillo y fríjol para consumo y para comercio. Estas actividades las aprendió de su familia especialmente de su padre. 

El ganado para la crianza y posterior comercialización en un tiangue de la ciudad, que esta a tres kilómetros de distancia de su casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar dos reces más, semilla mejorada, fertilizantes, abono, para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, entre otros. Esta inversión la efectuara con el objetivo de incrementar el número de ganado y para obtener una mayor producción, para que sus ventas sean altas. Su deseo es poder comprar un terreno en donde el ganado pueda alimentarse y ya no tener que seguir alquilando. A la vez que cosechara en su propio terreno.
texts.en:
Don Oscar is 52. He is married with two children, but both now have their own households. He has raised and sold cattle for over twenty years; this has always been his job. He currently has four cows. He also cultivates corn, sorghum, and beans for his family's consumption and for sale. He learned this work from his family, particularly from his father.
He raises the livestock and then sells them in a livestock market three kilometers from his home.
He is requesting a loan from Fundacion Campo for the purchase of two more cows, improved seed, fertilizers, and manure for cultivating 7,000 square meters of land, among other items. He will make this investment with the goal of increasing his livestock holdings and obtaining a higher production and higher sales. His desire is to be able to buy a plot of land where his livestock can graze so that he does not have to keep renting land for this purpose. He would also reap his own ground.

loans.use: to buy two more cows, improved seed, fertilizers and manure for cultivating 7,000 square meters of land; among other items.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married, and lives in the northern part of the city with her spouse and nine children. She has a business there where she makes and sells mahamri (dumplings). Her work schedule is 7am to 5pm Monday through Sunday. She has little competition and her customers are passersby in the neighborhood. 

While Khadija works toward making her dreams come true, she manages a profit margin on sales of no less than 24.5% and a daily inventory turnover rate. It is a successful investment of her Kiva loan, which is the third financing she’s gotten from Yehu Microfinance.  She'll use it to buy bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal for use in making dumplings.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel, tiene 44 años de edad, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de carne de marrano,ella tiene su negocio en su residencia ya que por la calidad de su producto ella es muy conocida en su localidad,como actividad secundaria ella cuenta con la con la capacitacion de personas que son comadronas, es asi como ella ayuda a su familia, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de marranitos porque el suguiente paso que ella piensa hacer es crecer y engordar ella los marranos ya que asi incrementara aun mas su ganacia y ayudar a sus hijos que estan estudiando, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Maria Isabel, age 44, has sold pork for five years. Her business is located in her home. Due to the quality of her product, she is quite well-known in the area. As a secondary job she trains midwives. This is how she supports her family. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of pigs because her next step is to raise and fatten them in order to increase her earnings and help her children, who are in school. She hopes that she will be able to help them with this loan.

loans.use: to buy hogs for raising, fattening, and quartering.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es propietaria y administradora de una tienda desde hace cinco años junto con su esposo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite, arroz, refrescos, etc. y para la ampliación de su tienda. Con el objetivo de fortalecer su negocio, mejorar sus ganancias, para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, entre ellos brindarles el estudio a sus dos hijos.

Lo que ella desea es proporcionarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, realizarse mejoras a su vivienda para tener mayor seguridad familiar.
texts.en:
Silvia is 43 years old and is married with two children. She has been the owner and administrator of a store for 5 years along with her husband.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy more basic goods such as sugar, oil, rice, beverages, etc. and to expand her store. Her goal is to strengthen her business, improve her earnings and to meet her family's needs, including providing schooling to her two children.

What she wishes for is to offer her family a better quality of life, carry out improvements to her home and have greater family security.

loans.use: to buy more basic goods such as sugar, oil, rice, beverages, etc. and to expand her store.

loans.name: Rempesa

texts.en:
Rempesa is 40 years old, married to Eunice and blessed with eight children. He has been a wheat farmer for the last 10 years earning a monthly income of KES 70,000. 

He is servicing his seventh loan of KES. 90,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. 

His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and ferterlizers

loans.name: Christ Roi 2 Group

texts.en:
Himess, age 38, is married with 6 children, ages 3 to 18 years old. All 6 of his children are attending school. He also cares for his elderly father. 

Himess is representing the Christ Roi 2 group. He sells wood and timber to builders and carpenters in Brazzaville. He has had this business for 3 years. He will use the loan to buy more wood for his business. His business strategy is to offer good customer service to his customers.
 
Himess has received 4 previous loans from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. Himess will continue to assist his children in their studies, and hopes to enable some to travel overseas to study.

loans.use: to pay for wood and timber.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Saumu is a single mother who has 4 children; one of whom is in school while the others dropped out of school.

Saumu and her family live in their own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. She has been operating an equipment selling business for over ten years selling in the open air. Her dream is to expand this existing business and to add hardware.

She is requesting a loan to buy jembes (digging hoes), pangas (machetes), and locks. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for the opportunity she is receiving because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy jembes (digging hoes), pangas (machetes) and locks.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi only went to school up to class eight; he did not proceed due to lack of finance. He currently sells livestock at the market. He is married to a very beautiful wife and they are blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. They live in their own house, which has two rooms and a sitting room, but no electricity or piped water.  

Kahindi is a very hardworking man despite his low level of education. He is a person who does not fear any challenges or risks. 

He is requesting the loan to buy chicken and goats for sale. Kahindi's dream is to have more income and to make sure that all his children become professionals and do not fall victim to a similar situation to the one he passed through.

loans.use: to buy chicken and goats for sale.

loans.name: Melleny

texts.en:
Melleny is a 38-year-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Hezron. They have three biological children aged between 5 and 12 years and are also taking care of her three nieces, aged 7, 10 and 13 years.

Melleny is a fishmonger and sells a variety of fish to her customers. She has been in this business for the last nine years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She has applied for her first loan from KADET, which she will use to buy more stock of fresh fish for sale. 

Melleny plans to use her profits to pay school fees for the children. Her dream is to become a fish supplier within Kisumu city.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fresh fish for sale.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en: Raymond is 51 years old. He is married and has been selling clothes for the past two years with success. This marks his third business loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers. He will use the anticipated profits to open another clothes shop. He hopes to excel in this business and in life.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers

loans.name: Hector Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Héctor tiene 24 años y es casado con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de 2 años, el Sr. Héctor se dedica a la confección de trajes (especialidad sacos) en su taller que se encuentra que se en la zona Manuela Pagadora,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Héctor va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de dos maquinas de coser para la confección de sus prendas de vestir,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Héctor enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el de no contar con la maquinaria necesaria para la confección de sus prendas de vestir y con las ganancias seguirá comprando materiales y maquinaria para mejorar su taller de confección, el Sr. Héctor es una persona joven Emprendedora con gamas de salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor is 24 years old and married, with a two-year old child. Héctor makes suits (specializing in jackets) in his shop, which is located in the Manuela Pagadora zone. 

This loan is his first sequence in the institution, and Héctor will use it to buy two sewing machines for making his clothing articles. The reason for requesting this loan is to increase his working capital. 

Héctor faces challenges in his business, such as a lack of necessary equipment for making his clothing articles. With his earnings he will continue buying materials and machinery to improve his sewing shop. 

Héctor is a young and enterprising person with hopes of getting ahead and improving the quality of life for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines for making suits (specializing in jackets)

loans.name: Mayli Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Mayli ha logrado muchas metas, está trabajando bastante juntamente con su esposo, ella se dedican a la confección de camisas. Los clientes le han hecho muchos pedidos y necesitan comprar tela, por rollos y en varios colores. Le ha ido muy bien  en sus pedidos  y se ve en la necesidad de solicitar una cantidad más grande de préstamo para poder sacar los pedidos de sus clientes.ella lo nececita para la compra de rollos de telas para la confeccion de tejidos.   Su sueño es  tener una casa ms grande en un lugar con muchos árboles  porque aun viven a un costado donde está su pequeño taller y las maquinas hacen mucho ruido. Ella ha alcanzado muchas metas y se siente muy feliz porque Dios no la ha dejado sola ya que ha tenido las oportunidades  no importando la distancia a través de ustedes y está muy agradecida por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mayli has achieved many goals and is working a great deal. Mayli and her husband make their living jointly, producing blouses. Their clients have made many requests and they need to buy fabric, by the roll and in various colors. In the past her commissions have gone very well and she sees the necessity of requesting a greater loan in order to be able to meet her clients' requests. She will use the loan to buy rolls of fabric for making textiles. 

Her dream is to have a larger house in a place with many trees, because although they live just to the side of their little shop, the machines make a lot of noise. She has achieved many goals and she feels happy because God has always been with her, granting her many opportunities. No matter the distance between you, she is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric in order to make textiles.

loans.name: Mwadiga

texts.en:
Mwadiga currently earns money through operating a kiosk that is located beside his house in his rural village on the south coast of Kenya. He has been running this kiosk for the last three years. In addition, he does farming together with his wife, who has one infant. He works more than eight hours a day. He does this because he needs to cover his family’s food and medical expenses. They do not have medical insurance. He currently lives in his own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

He needs the loan to add stocks of maize and wheat flour to his kiosk. Mwadiga’s dream is to become independent and to purchase a grinding machine in the future.

loans.use: to add stocks of maize and wheat flour to his kiosk.

loans.name: Olepet

texts.en:
Olepet is 40 years old and married to Noomali. They are blessed with five children. He has been a wheat farmer for the last 15 years and he earns a monthly income of 50,000 KES.

This is his seventh loan from KADET. He has requested 90,000 KES, which will help him in preparing his farm and purchasing inputs.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm. His dreams for the future are to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his crops

loans.name: Xiomara Yamileth

texts.es:
Xiomara tiene 30 años de edad, es casada. Ella cuenta con dos años de experiencia en el servicio de un molino de maíz junto con su esposo, que esta instalado en su vivienda. Además tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite, arroz, etc. De esta manera satisfacera la demanda de sus clientes, aprovechando que a los alrededores de su hogar no existe otra tienda, teniendo la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos económicos.  Ella lo que espera es mejorar su calidad de vida y su vivienda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 30 years old and married. She has two years of experience with the service of a corn mill, together with her husband, and it is installed in their home. She also has a general store with basic goods.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy more basic goods like sugar, oil, rice, etc. This way she can satisfy her clients' demand, taking advantage of the fact that there are no other stores around her home, giving her the opportunity to improve her financial income.

She hopes to improve her quality of life and house for her children.

loans.use: to buy basic goods such as sugar, oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Wendo

texts.en: Wendo  is a 38-year-old married man. He has 3 children and all are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Fatuma and she sells food. Wendo operates a boda boda (motorcycle) business. He's worked in this business for one year. His primary customers are local residents. Wendo's greatest business challenges are his hired bike drivers who do not return to him the full amount they have earned. He says his highest monthly expense is food.  He owns a house with water but no electricity. Wendo will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase another motorbike. Wendo aspires to hire employees in the future. He joined Yehu because of its product varieties.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is from the village of Tiribe, Kenya. She is 36 years old and married to Sammy. The couple has four children, who are the source of their greatest joy, and the reason why they both strive. Three of their children are enrolled in school while the other is still too young.

Mwanarusi is an enterprising woman who owns a kiosk that she has run for almost two years. She also sells fruits and vegetables outside her kiosk. This is how she helps her family and provides them with what they need for a good life without hardships; even as she gets support from her husband who  works in the private sector.

Mwanamisi tells us that she is not afraid to work, because everything she does is for her family.

She says that her dream is to see that her children are educated and have reached University level. She is requesting the loan in order to buy sugar, maize flour, and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz es socia del banco comunal 26-71, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es de un corazón cálido, amable y gentil, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Luz tiene 55 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora se dedica hace algunos años al comercio, vende frutas ambulantemente de miércoles a domingo sin un horario fijo, los demás días labora en la limpieza de casas o cuando le llaman lava ropa ajena. 

Se encuentra en el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando frutas para tener una mayor variedad de productos.
 
Su meta es crecer mucho más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the communal bank 26-71. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its architectural beauty and its gastronomy—which captivates the palates of locals and visitors alike. The people of Cuenca are warm-hearted, friendly, and courteous. They still maintain the culture and traditions of the native peoples.

Luz is fifty-five years old and single with no children. She rents her home.
 
Luz is a hardworking woman who has made her living in commerce for many years. She sells fruit in street markets from Wednesday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. The other days she works cleaning houses or taking in laundry when it is available. 

She is now on her fifth loan achieved through the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy fruits in order to have a greater variety of produce.

Her goal is to grow her business considerably.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru: Розия 56 летняя женщина, замужем, имеет четверых детей. Она работает в швейной фабрике, мотальщицей. У неё больная старая мама, которая болеет онкологическим заболеванием. Для её лечения и покупки нужных лекарств требуется большие деньги. Её мать на содержании младшего брата Розии, но  ее брат еле содержит свою жену и детей поэтому Розия решила помочь ему в лечении матери.На полученный кредит  оплатит услуги клиники и лечебные процедуры. Её заработная плата вполне хватает на погашение кредита, т.к в её семье все семейные расходы несёт её старший сын, работающий авто мастером на станции.
texts.en: Roziya is 56, married and has four children. She works in a garment factory, where she operates a winding machine. She has a sick elderly mother who is suffering from cancer. It is extremely expensive to buy medical treatment for her. Her mother lives under the care of Roziya's younger brother, but he can barely support his wife and children. So Roziya decided to help him get treatment for their mother. She will use this loan to pay for clinical services and medical procedures. Her salary will be enough to cover the entire loan, since in her family all of the expenses are being borne by her eldest son, who works as an auto mechanic at the bus station.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment

loans.name: Duo Aquarius Group

texts.es:
LAS SEÑORAS VIOLETA Y LEDY SON INTEGRANTES DEL DUO AQUARIUS
 LA SEÑORA LEDY ACTUALMENTE ES PROPIETARIA DE UN SALÓN DE ESTÉTICA EL CUAL SE UBICA EN LA CALLE PRINCIPAL DE LA COMUNIDAD DONDE VIVE, ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y CADA DIA SE ESFUERZA POR TENER SU NEGOCIO EN BUENAS CONDICIONES PARA QUE LOS CLIENTES QUE LA VISITEN SE SIENTAN SATISFECHOS DEL SERVIO QUE LES PRESTA COMO LO ES CORTE DE CABELLO, TINTES, MANICURE, ETC. SU SUEÑO ES SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS DANDOLES UNA CARRERA PARA QUE ELLOS TENGAN MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES EN UN FUTURO,  Y NO TENER LA PREOCUPACION  QUE  SIGAN CAMINOS EQUIVOCADOS YA QUE EL LUGAR DONDE ELLOS VIVEN ES CATALOGADA COMO ZONA NO MUY SEGURA,ELLA ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN DAR ESE APOYO QUE ELLA NECECITA YA QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE COSMETICOS Y METERIALES PARA SU ESTETICA.
texts.en:
Violeta and Ledy and members of Duo Aquarius. Ledy is currently the owner of a beauty salon which is located on the main street of the community where she lives. She is a single mother and everyday she works to have her business in good condition so that when her customer come to her, they feel satisfied with the service that she gives them. Her work includes hair cuts, dyes and manicures. 

Her dream is to help her children get ahead by giving them a path for them to have better opportunities in the future, without the worry that they take the wrong paths because the area where they live in considered not very safe. She hopes that the support she needs can be given to her; she is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics and beauty supplies.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Najmidin

texts.ru: Нажмидин молодой парень в возрасте 25 лет , женат, имеет двоих детей. Он маляр. Нажмиддин очень веселый и жизнерадостный человек.Дом где он живет очень в плохом состояние.Он давно хочет сделать ремонт но никак не может накопить денег потому что все что он зарабатывает все уходит на семейные нужды.Посоветовавший с семьей он решил взять кредит.На полученный кредит он хочет купить строительные материалы, сделать ремонт в своем доме и создать немного комфорта для своих детей.Благодарит за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Najmidin is a young fellow of 25, married, and has two children. He is a painter. Najmidin is a very happy and cheerful person. The house he lives in is in very poor condition. For a long time he has wanted to make repairs, but he could never save enough money because everything he earns goes to taking care of his family. After consulting with his family, he decided to apply for a loan. He wants to use the loan to buy building materials, make repairs to his house, and create a bit of comfort for his children. He thanks you for your financial support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
40 year old Nyamvula is a resident of Tiribe, Kenya. She is married and has six children between preparatory school and class eight. Nyamvula operates a cereal store where she sells maize. Other sources of income are from earnings from her husband. She is a very industrious woman who is enterprising and a risk taker.

Nyamvula is asking for a loan to buy stock of maize for sale. She hopes that with additional capital, she can continue to make better profits from her business.

She dreams of opening a wholesale store in the future for selling cereals. She also does farming over the weekends and her class eight son helps her in selling in her store.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize for sale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Doña Sofia Jiatz Morales, se ve en la necesidad de nuevamente pedir un nuevo capital para su pequeña empresa. Dedicándose a la confección de camisas por varios años, la tela que tiene ya no le alcanza y al ver los pedidos de sus clientes se da cuenta que también necesita comprar más colores de tela.  Ella compra la tela por rollos y le cuesta Q 700.00 el rollo. Su esposo sigue apoyándola en todo y los dos han sabido sacar adelante esta nueva oportunidad de levantarse luego del fracaso que tuvieron hace varios años por las borracheras de su esposo. Esta muy agradecida por su apoyo y les bendice grandemente donde quiera que se encuentren.
texts.en: Sofia Jiatz Morales sees the need to request a new loan for her small business. She has had a business making shirts for a number of years.  She doesn't have enough fabric to fill all of her customer's orders, and she also realized that she needs more colors of fabric.  She buys fabric by the bolt, and it costs 700 Guatemalan quetzales.  Her husband supports her in everything she does, and the two of them have managed to get ahead and pull themselves up after the trouble they had a number of years ago due to her husband's drinking.  Sofia is very grateful for your support, and she greatly blesses you wherever you are.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make shirts to sell

loans.name: Rafaela Isabel

texts.es:
Rafaela sigue con sus ventas de ropa y alquiler de cuartos, que es con lo que más se ayuda, teniendo ingreso fijo, tiene una hija soltera y una nieta de seis años, dando educación.
Su meta ha sido el mejoramiento de vivienda tanto a  su casa como los cuartos que alquila, con fondos propios y financiamientos otorgado ha logrado las mejora a corto plazo, con este nuevo préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para embaldozar  parte de enfrente de la casa que es grande,  mejorando esta condición en higiene, ya que se le hace mucho lodo. Materiales a utilizar, arena, veinte bolsa de cemento y piedrín.
texts.en:
Rafaela is continuing her clothing sales and renting rooms. Having a set income is most helpful. She has a single daughter and a 6 year old granddaughter for whom she provides education. 

Her goal has been to improve her dwelling, as much to her house as to her rooms that she rents. With her own funds and financing granted to her, she has been able to improve them for the short term. With this new loan she will buy construction materials to tile the front of her house, which is large. This will improve the hygienic condition because a lot of mud is created there. The materials she will use are sand, 20 bags of cement and gravel.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to tile the front of her house.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a 50-year-old married man. He has six children and three are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Zainab and she operates a food kiosk business. Rashid operates an M-PESA business in a shop. He's worked in this business for six months. Her primary customers are from the community. Rashid's other source of income comes from sales from farm produce. He describes his greatest business challenge to be market competition and system delays and his highest monthly expense is spent on food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Rashid will use the KES 30000 loan to add M-PESA float. Rashid aspires to hire employees and open many branches in the future. He joined Yehu because of its product varieties and loan lead time.

loans.use: to add M-PESA float.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a widowed woman with seven children: four young men and three ladies who are all adults. 

She currently earns income by selling fruits and vegetables from her home. Her children provide her with some other sources of income. In addition, Kwekwe is farming to supplement her income. With the income she earns, she is able to proceed forward and not depend on anyone. However, she does not have enough capital to expand the business and reach her goal of opening a shop. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables that she can sell for additional income.

Kwekwe tells us that her major challenge is seasonality, as some fruits and vegetables become scarce during the dry season.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Unión Y Fuerza  (Junín) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión Y Fuerza se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y  del Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Letty, tiene 41 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen cuatro hijos, uno de ellos mayores de edad y tres de 16, 12 y 10 años que estudian en colegio. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga para ganar algo y con esto poder ayudara  a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, desde hace varios años atrás con la ayuda de su marido construyeron un pequeño corral en el cual se dedica a la cría de chanchos, después y poco a poco también construyeron un pequeño galpón para la cría de pollos, nos cuenta que esto le ha servido para poder ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos que generan sus estudios, ella compra los animalitos cuando están pequeños, los mantiene por tres meses y luego los entrega a comerciantes en el mercado local,  le ayudan sus hijos y su marido.

Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda el banco. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

En la foto se encuentra La supervisora de crédito, es la señora con lentes que está en el centro de la foto con una camiseta azul con amarillo.
texts.en:
The Unity and Strength Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the Junín region; this area is known for its kind and hardworking people. The best liquor in the province and in all of Ecuador is distilled here. 

This is a group of people who decided to come together and form a Communal Bank, which has benefited them greatly, since with the loans they have been able to improve their small businesses. They are employed in diverse activities, such as business, the services, and food sales, among others. 

In this place, we met Letty. She is 41 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has four children – one adult and three others ages 16, 12, and 10 years, who are still in school. Her husband works in agriculture. 

In order to earn an income and help her husband with the household expenses, some years ago our friend assisted him in constructing a small farmyard where they raise pigs. Little by little, they also built a small chicken coop. She tells us that this has allowed them to help their children with school expenses. She buys the animals when they are young, raises them for three months, and later delivers them to merchants in the local market; her children and husband help her out. 

This loan is for the purchase of food and medications for both the chickens and the pigs. She has been with the Communal Bank since its inception, and she likes it because of the assistance that the bank offers her. Her dream is that her children will have a good education. In the photograph is the loan supervisor; she is the woman with glasses in the center of the picture, wearing a blue and yellow shirt.

loans.use: to buy food and medications for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is from the town of Mombasa. She's a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She operates a kiosk where she sells a variety of products including maize and wheat flour, soap, rice and other fast-selling goods. Aside from that, she gets other income from her husband who works in a certain company.

Saumu is a very hardworking, responsible and honest lady, as her customers say. Her longtime dream is to work independently, so that she no longer depends on someone else. Through her hard work and dedication, she has achieved what she so desired and already has her own kiosk. She requests this loan in order to add stock of maize flour, rice and sugar, so that she can continue to offer her customers the variety to which they are accustomed. 

Saumu gives thanks for the opportunity she's being given.

loans.use: to add stock of maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (pictured here), age 42, is a tailor. Her husband, Him, age 43, is a chef. He cooks for wedding parties and other occasions. In addition, the couple also grows rice when the rice-farming season comes. 

Chanthy is requesting her first loan of $700 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and to buy a water-pumping machine to spray her rice farm.    

Chanthy and her husband live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have three children. One child is a garment worker, another is in grade 9 and the other one is still young.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides and to buy a water-pumping machine to spray her rice farm.

loans.name: Gladys Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys es socia del banco comunal 26-71, vive la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es de un corazón cálido, amable y gentil, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Gladys tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller propio en donde fabrica muebles, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Gladys nos comenta que por el momento se encuentra gozando de muy buena salud al igual que están todos los miembros que conforman su familia. 

Nuestra socia labora conjuntamente con su esposo en la elaboración de muebles, actividad que la desempeña hace 10 años y también vende hace 2 años productos toperware (platicos).

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los muebles y en productos toperware, la cancelación de su crédito lo realizo sin dificultad. El dinero  de este crédito lo va a invertir en lo mismo que el crédito anterior. El banco comunal le gusta porque recibe una atención personalizada por parte del promotor de crédito y los créditos le benefician para seguir creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the communal bank 26-71. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its architectural beauty and its cuisine, which captivates the palates of locals and visitors alike. The people of Cuenca are warm-hearted, friendly, and courteous. They still maintain the culture and traditions of the native peoples.

Gladys is thirty years old and married with two children of twelve and eight years of age. Her older son is in high school and her younger daughter is studying in a little school in the city. Her husband has his own shop where he makes furniture. They don't own a house and so live in a rented one.

Gladys tells us that at the moment she finds herself enjoying very good health, along with all the other members of her family.

Gladys works jointly with her husband making furniture, a business that they have maintained for the past ten years. For the past two years, Gladys has also sold plastic Tupperware products.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy primary materials for making furniture (such as wood), as well as Tupperware products. She paid back the previous loan without any difficulty and plans to use the money from this loan in the same way. She likes the communal bank because she receives personalized attention from the loan promoter and the loans enable Gladys and her husband to continue with their businesses.

loans.use: to buy plastic Tupperware products and wood.

loans.name: Buazhar

texts.ru: Буажар  66 лет,  воспитала 5 детей.   В 1998 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Буажар начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Буажар сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 20,000 сом (KGS). К сожалению, некоторое время назад в торговом месте произошел пожар, сгорела часть товара и холодильник. В целях восстановления товарного запаса и оборудования, Буажар обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Буажар  планирует вложить в расширение бизнес – деятельности за счет скотоводства.
texts.en: Buazhar is 66 years old, and raised five children. In 1998, searching for a source of income for her family, Buazhar began her own business selling groceries with a initial investment of 10,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Buazhar managed to grow her business with monthly earnings of about 20,000 soms (KGS). Unfortunately, not long ago there was a fire in her shop that destroyed a portion of her inventory and her refrigerator. With the goal of restoring her inventory and equipment, Buazhar has come to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 soms (KGS). Buazhar plans to invest the income from the loan into expanding her business activity into animal husbandry.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Beljing Group

texts.en:
Peter, who is in his late 20s, is married with two children. One of them goes to school. He has been selling chips since 2006. He works from 11:00 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a plot of land and buy chairs and table for the use of his customers. He also paid household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes to make and sell more chips. His dream is to one day be able to build his house.

Peter will share this loan with his loan group, Beljing, which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes to make and sell more chips.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a thirty-two-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to university level. He has been a farmer for the last twelve years, and his main hardships are price fluctuation, inflation, and inadequate capital to buy farm inputs. He has a vision of buying land to grow more crops and diversify his farming activities to include animal rearing. Solomon intends to use the loan facility to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.use: to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a twenty-five-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a vision of building a permanent home. 

He has been in the transport business for the last three years and his main hardship is high fuel and transportation costs. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include a retail shop and owning at least three taxis within the next six years. 

Francis needs a loan to buy a taxi for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a taxi for his transport business.

loans.name: Silvia Sara

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia es socia del banco comunal 26-71, vive la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es de un corazón cálido, amable y gentil, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Silvia tiene 36 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo tiene una discapacidad por lo que recibe estimulación y su segunda hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios conduciendo una unidad de taxis, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Silvia se encuentra gozando de buena salud, pero se encuentra preocupada por la salud de su hijo que se encuentra delicado y aumenta el riesgo por su discapacidad.
 
La Señora. Silvia se dedica a  la venta de cosméticos, actividad que la desempeña hace 6 años, ella se ha visto en la necesidad de aportar a la economía de su hogar por el bienestar sus hijos.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo ha invirtió en la compra de cosméticos para aumentar la variedad de sus productos y se encuentra feliz ya que en sus ventas le va muy bien y no ha tenido problemas en cancelar dicho crédito. Este crédito también lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos. La banca comunal le gusta por los créditos son rápidos y sin mucho papeleo, pero debido a los problemas de salud de su hijo le es difícil asistir a las reuniones.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the communal bank 26-71. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its architectural beauty and its cuisine, which captivates the palates of locals and visitors alike. The people of Cuenca are warmhearted, friendly, and courteous. They still maintain the culture and traditions of the region's native peoples.

Silvia is thirty-six years old and married with three children of thirteen, ten, and one year(s) of age. Her oldest son has a disability for which he receives stimulation, and her second child, a daughter, is studying in a little school in the city. Her husband is a chauffeur by profession and lends his services driving a unit of taxis. They do not have their own home, and so live in her mother's house, with whom they share expenses.

Silvia finds herself enjoying good health, though she is worried about her son, whose health is delicate, which augments the risks of his disability.
 
Silvia makes her living selling cosmetics, a business she has maintained for the past six years. She has seen the necessity of contributing to the family income for the well-being of her children.
Silvia used the money from the earlier loan to buy cosmetics to expand the variety of her products and she has been happy with the result, since her sales are going very well and she has not had problems paying back the aforementioned loan. She will also use this loan to buy cosmetics. She likes the communal bank for providing loans quickly and without much paperwork, though due to her son's health problems it is difficult to attend the meetings.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah received a great boost from the business. He purchased tires and was able to do some sales. He was also able to pay for his children’s school fees. He is asking for another loan to add more stock into his business and improve the quality of life of his family from the income of this loan.

loans.use: to buy spare tires for his business.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi has submitted her application for another loan and says she looks forward to continuing with the business since it has helped her meet family needs. During the loan term, one of her children was admitted to a high school and is continuing with her education. 

From this loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings, she will restock her retail and grocery stall. She looks forward to opening other businesses and educating her children to achieve tertiary education.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock such as sugar, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is aged 40 years and she is charged with the sole responsibility of looking after her three children. 

She started by selling charcoal to different areas and after accumulating enough capital, she set up a retail shop. Inadequate capital to purchase enough stock and lack of refrigeration services for perishables are her major challenges that hinder her business. 

Her dream is to educate her children and move her business to a more permanent location. 

Grace wants a loan to buy a generator and fridge for her business.

loans.use: to buy a generator and fridge for her business.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Noemi tiene 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores de edad que están estudiando. Ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a lavar y planchar de otras personas que pagan por sus servicios. Dicho servicio lo presta en la casa de sus clientes donde realiza su labor.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para colocarle el techo a su casa que es lo que le hace falta para tener lo necesario para vivir en su casa. Protegiéndola del sol y del agua, sintiéndose segura en la noche y con privacidad. Ella comenta que después de cancelar este crédito, solicitara otro para continuar con las mejoras en la vivienda.
texts.en:
Noemi is thirty-nine years old with two children, who are both minors and in school. She has made her living for the past fifteen years washing and ironing for other people who pay for her services. She offers this service in her clients' homes.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to repair the roof of her house, which it needs in order to be livable—that is, in order to protect them from sun and rain and so that they can feel safe at night, and have privacy. She tells us that after paying back this loan, she will request another in order to continue improving her home.

loans.use: to put a roof on her house, which it needs before it can be livable.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya and is married with two children aged 7 and 2 years. She is aged 29 years and has been in active farming for five successive years with her major production being poultry and dairy products.

Violet has requested a loan of 51,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo. She says she will buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and use the remaining 20,000 KES to build a modern dairy unit for her dairy cows. She reiterates that her five years in mixed farming have proved to her the great potential in the business as well as the inherent challenges like dairy and poultry diseases. She remains enthusiastic about dairy farming and believes it will help her meet her family's basic needs.

Violet wishes to have at least four dairy cows in the near future.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Soka, who is his early 30s, is married with one small child. He has been selling local chicken since 2006. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be his sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a plot, build a moderate house in the village, marry a wife, buy five cows, and cover household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more local chicken to resell. His dream is to one day be able to have a house in Dar.

Soka will share this loan with his loan group, Iringa, which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more local chicken to resell.

loans.name: Abubaker

texts.en: Abubaker is 43 years old and married with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He started by selling hides and skins and with the profits earned he started a retail shop. His dream is to educate his children and to move his business to a more permanent location. Inadequate capital is his challenge, and his dream is to have a wholesale shop. Abubaker needs the loan facility to buy general merchandise such as salt and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as salt and bread to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson wants a loan to buy more clothes for resale. He is a forty-three-year-old hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of looking after his six children, who are all in school. Inadequate capital to purchase stock is his major challenge. 

His personal goal is to educate his children. Expanding his business into new markets is his dream.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 24 years old living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with a responsibility of looking after his two children. He is in the transport business, specifically motorcycles, and with the proceeds he has been able to provide the basics to his family. He desires to educate his children, expand his business into new markets, and diversify it to include cattle rearing. High fuel and transportation costs affects his business. Charles intends to use the loan facility to buy cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30, married, has one child, and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells clothes. He started as a market vendor but later moved into rented premises after accumulating enough capital.

Inadequate capital to meet the different tastes of consumers is his challenge. He desires to educate his children and expand the business into new markets. Emmanuel needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanashabani

texts.en: Mwanashabani is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children and both of them are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Salim Juma, and he works in outside employment. Mwanashabani operates a salon and sells her goods in a shop. She has worked in this business for one year. Her primary customers are from the community. Mwanashabani's other source of income comes from her spouse. She describes her greatest business challenge to be market competition. Her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Mwanashabani will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy boxes of hair, hair chemicals, and treatments. She aspires to hire employees in the future. She joined Yehu for their variety of products.

loans.use: To buy boxes of hair, hair chemicals, and treatments

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy used her Kiva loan to buy sacks of fish to sell. She needs these items to make the food that she sells in her restaurant. By using the loan, she got discounts for volume, which gave her a little extra money and increased her inventory.

She is applying for a new loan to get a cooler to store fish for resale. This will allow her to keep these ingredients fresh and preserved. Also, she will continue buying wholesale because this has gone very well for her.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler for storing fish

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 36 years old, married, has three children, and lives in Masindi, Uganda. For the past 10 years he has been in poultry farming. He used his personal savings as startup capital for his business. His dream is to educate his children and diversify business to include piggery. Price fluctuations and inflation hinders his business. Peter wants a loan buy chicken feed and medicine for his poultry project.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and medicine for his poultry project.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie is aged forty, married, and charged with the responsibility of looking after her five children. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She sells clothes. Connie got the start up capital from her husband. She meets the challenge of customers not paying on time and high rent costs. Education and buying land to grow crops are her dreams. Connie wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 46-year-old lady from Kisumu town.  She is married to Jack, and they have four children, who are aged 14 to 24 years old.

Penina is a fishmonger within Kisumu.  She has been doing this business for five years, and her monthly income is KES 20,000. She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of fresh fish to sell. She will use the profit from the business to expand her fish stock.

Her dream is to become the sole supplier of fish for the whole market.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 37-year-old married man with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He trades in agricultural produce and has spent seven years in the business. He started with 30,000 Ugandan shillings and now has over a million shillings for the business. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and inflation.
He has a personal goal of building a permanent home and a business goal of expanding the business into new market areas.

Richard wants a loan to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a 25-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of upgrading his studies. He has been running a foreign exchange bureau for the last two years and he is also a banker. His main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the high demand. He has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and hiring employees to help expand his business. Solomon needs the loan to buy more currency to sell.

loans.use: to buy more currency to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 50-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been growing bananas and citrus fruits like oranges and mangoes for three years. His hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. His business goals are buying land to grow more crops and hiring employees to help expand the business. Robert wants money to hire a tractor and human labour for farming.

loans.use: to hire a tractor and human labour for farming.

loans.name: Sirasi

texts.en: Sirasi is a 37-year-old married man with seven children. He has been in retail for ten years; he started his shop with 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings. His hardships are taxes, customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock, theft, price fluctuations, and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and buying a car. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand the business. He wants money to buy sugar, soap, and saucepans.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, and saucepans.

loans.name: Jana

texts.en: Jana is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a butcher shop for six years. He started with 100,000 Ugandan shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuation, and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding the business into new markets. Jana wants money to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has had a retail shop for six years. He started with 600,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings in working capital. His hardships are theft, inadequate capital to purchase enough stock, price fluctuations and inflation. 

His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business goals are to expand the business into new markets and move it to a more permanent location. Emmanuel wants money to buy clothes, bags, radios and children's wear to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bags, radios and children's wear to sell.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 6 children. 

Marta sells hypo-cleaner in her local community.  It is used to disinfect utensils and clean clothes.  She has had in business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 4,000 to buy more stocks hypo-cleaner to resell.

Marta has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Marta hopes to improve her business to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks hypo-cleaner.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Carmelita sells snacks, like banana cake and fruit cake, in her local community . She has been in business for five years.  She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make snacks, like sugar, flour, cheese and margarine.

Carmelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Carmelita hopes to improve her business and ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cheese and margarine.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 39  years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with five children.  

Annie runs a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages.  She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Annie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Annie hopes to improve her business to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Merla has a food stall in a nearby public market that sells meat, dressed chicken and chorizo.  She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan for 4,000 to buy more meat, dressed chicken and chorizo to resell.

Merla has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future,Merla hopes to improve her business to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more meat, dressed chicken and chorizo to resell.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 34  years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children.  

Ivy has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages.  She has been in business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 4,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Ivy has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Ivy hopes to improve her business to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
This is Albina, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is the mother of 5 children and married to Antonio, a vendor. By the grace of God, Albina has managed to support her older children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to send her children to college and to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Albina operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other products of the like. One of the products is belts, but what she focuses on selling right now are kitchen utensils. Customers are attracted to buy from her due to the low prices and the many options they are offered. Albina's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will utilize the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Albina dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all the hard work on her business. She also hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rowena has a vegetable garden from which she harvests eggplants during harvest time. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her eggplant garden.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Janeth sells cosmetics from AVON and NATASHA. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more cosmetics from AVON and NATASHA, like make up, body lotion and facial cleanser.

Janeth became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics from AVON and NATASHA

loans.name: Bang

texts.en:
Bang is from Baray district, Kompong Tom. She is in the business of cultivating rice to help her husband generate income. She is 36 years old and has three school-aged children, all of whom are in need of daily allowances. Bang works at the rice field in both the rainy season and dry season. She typically earns around USD 2.00 per day. She has been in this for 12 years.

Bang doesn’t own a vehicle for use in the family, so she wants to borrow a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase a used motorcycle for household use. This will help the family with their personal transportation. In addition, she can reduce some expenses on transportation fees as she did previously. 

In the future, Bang hopes to upgrade her living standards and achieve her business goal. This will be her second loan from lenders. She would appreciate it if she can get the loan to develop her family.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Fredelito

texts.en:
This is Fredelito, 42, a resident of Manila in the Philippines. He is married to Evangeline, a businesswoman, and is the father of four children, of whom three are in elementary school and one is in high school. By the grace of God, Fredelito has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to send them to college. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Fredelito, as he himself has been a college graduate, and he believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Fredelito operates a buy and sell business, specifically, diapers. What he basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it piecemeal to make a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, and other products of the like, but as mentioned earlier, he focuses on selling diapers. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options offered. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 200 Philippine pesos in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a loan of 50,000 pesos. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantity and variety of products to expand his inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Fredelito dreams of being able to give his children a good and high-quality education through all his hard work on his business. He is hoping to be able to expand soon and to increase the number of his loyal customers. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. At these meetings, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (beams, cement, doors, window frames, zinc sheets, etc.).

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: To strive for a living as a 33-year-old mother of two dependent kids, Sophal has been on various businesses such as raising pigs, selling vegetables, and working for others for pay. With these businesses for 5 years, she is able to save about 10,000 KHR per day. This is the fifth cycle for Sophal with KIVA's partner, VisionFund. The past four loans have improved her living standard gradually and helped her business growth. Confidently, she has formed a new group loan with two other members. Her loan application is for 1,000,000 KHR while one of her members is applying for 600,000 KHR and the other member is requesting 800,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy 2 pigs, pig feed, and to buy vegetables for sale. She hopes to raise her pigs healthfully so that she will have more profit for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To buy 2 pigs, pig feed, and to buy vegetables for sale

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Jona has a shop that buys and sells cellphone load. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy cell phone loads from GLOBE and SMART.

Jona became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cell phone load from GLOBE and SMART to resell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 26 years old and married with 3 children.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roselyn has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en: Abegail is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Abegail  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Abegail became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Abegail hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 37 years old and married with 6 children.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, growing bananas in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been growing bananas for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 57 years old and has 5 children. Daisy is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Daisy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Daisy has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 46 years old and single.

Rhodora is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more feed for her pigs.

Rhodora has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more feed for her pigs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her abaca weaving.

She has been in this business for 4 years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Dorina is selling RTW's in their local community. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 to buy stocks of RTW's to re-sell like t shirts, pants and skirts.
Dorina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Dorina hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of RTW'S (ready-to-wear clothing) to re-sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pacita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Pacita has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from raha making.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en: Liezyl is 31 years old and married with three children. With all her children in school, Liezyl works very hard to provide for them. Liezyl runs a sari sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. Liezyl has been in this business for three years, and she sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods and other grocery products. In the future, Liezyl would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 29 years old and married.

Lucel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Lucel has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for a year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lucel aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 34 years old and married with 2 children.

Mariam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Mariam has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling "copra" (dried coconut meat).

Mariam aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mercy is 38 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Mercy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for fishing boat maintenance.

Mercy has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for fishing boat maintenance

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines.

Milagros requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Nadou Huguette Seth's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Nadou Huguette, la responsable, est âgée de 33 ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dans une école de la ville, Nadou Huguette a une boutique où elle vend des sacs de maïs depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans les villages du Bénin. En vue d'augmenter son capital et de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Nadou Huguette a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev. Ce concours lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'améliorer le régime alimentaire de sa famille. Nadou Huguette se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
These two women are mutually guaranteeing their group loan. Nadou Huguette, the leader, is 33 years old. Married and the mother of three children attending a local school, Nadou Huguette has a shop where she has been selling sacks of corn for several years, and for which she gets her supplies in the villages of Benin.

With an eye to increasing her capital and meeting customer demand, Nadou Huguette has sought and obtained financial assistance from Finadev. This assistance will allow her to contribute to the education of her children and to improve the family's diet. Nadou Huguette is the woman at left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of corn.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Julieta makes and sells tomb plaques in their community. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 to buy raw materials used in making tomb plaques like white cement and ink for lettering names.
Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials used in making tomb plaques

loans.name: Bibiane

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans, Bibiane s'est spécialisée dans la vente des céréales depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire afin de combler les attentes de sa clientèle qui augmentent sans cesse compte tenu du bon emplacement de son fonds de commerce, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Le présent crédit lui permettra d'acheter des sacs de maïs, de gari et d'haricot. Bibiane avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of five children in school - the eldest 15 years old and the youngest five years old - Bibiane has been specializing in the sale of cereals for years. She gets her supplies in the villages of Benin.

With the goal of increasing her sales in order to meet the expectations of her customer base, which is growing continuously due to the good location of her business, Bibiane has sought and obtained a microloan from Finadev. The current loan will allow her to purchase sacks of corn, gari [coarse cassava flour] and beans.

With her savings, Bibiane wants to contribute to the educational expenses of her children and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of corn, one sack of gari [coarse cassava flour], and one sack of beans.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 49 years old and married with 9 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nieves is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nieves has been farming rice for 26 years and also earns additional income from a sari sari store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farms supplies

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou habite au Sénégal. Elle exerce l’activité d’enseignante mais évolue parallèlement dans le domaine du commerce ou elle capitalise une expérience de 5 ans dans la vente des accessoires de femmes. Elle est mariée et participe dans les charges du foyer. Elle assure le paiement des factures d’eau et d’électricité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  ou elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat accessoires de femmes a vendre. Elle souhaite renforcer son fond de roulement, accroitre ses bénéfices  afin de mieux supporter ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mrs. Seynabou lives in Senegal. She works as a teacher but is also advancing in the business sector, where she capitalizes on five years of experience in the sale of women's accessories.

She is married and contributes to the household expenses. She sees to the payment of the water and electricity bills. She is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC, where she has already repaid a previous loan.
